Reviews.Title: “Sunset Fishermen Village.”
Reviews.Author: Addeo800
Reviews.Content: I bought this time share approx. 7 years ago and love this place more and more. All the employers have been there for many years and the staff treats you well. You also have the option to look at different Unit and choose which one suites you.I used to take the new ones, but now my kids have discovered Units with a loft and that gives them more privacy. Marcel and Luis are awesome. Luis is the entertainer for the adults and mostly the kids. He does a wonderful job. Marcel always remembers you. I don't know how he does it. But he helps with everything. I Love this place because it's small and not overwhelming. You can walk into Playa Del Carmen and have great dinners there..

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Jamie D
Reviews.Content: Fisherman's was absolutely beautiful. The views were breathtaking and the condo we stayed at was so cozy beautifully furnished. Very easy to cook with maid service as needed. The beach was so clean. The sand so white you could walk for miles without ever getting hot. My favorite was the beds on the beach. Made you feel like a million bucks. Had a wonderful time and would go back again. There are Mayan Ruins in the neighborhood and a stunning golf course so walking to town was a pleasure because it too was paradise!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rude welcome....”
Reviews.Author: PiscesLady
Reviews.Content: I am staying in Playadelcarmen for 4 months. Having condsidered staying here I took a bike ride in. I had only just stopped for a brief second , wanting to get a brochure. Not even off my bike I was vey promptly and rudely showed where to put my bike,with the scooters, by Marcios. I said I wasn't staying and would just like a brochure as I was considering staying here next time. He continued to be rude and him and the other fellow laughed as I left. I think I will cross this place off my list.

Reviews.Title: “Sunset Fishermen Playa del Carmen Fans”
Reviews.Author: Felwell
Reviews.Content: From the year 1999 we vacation every year in Quintana Roo, since we discovered Sunset Fishermen In Playa del Carmen we go there yearly the staff are friendly, we learned that the hotel did some renovations and upgrades of the rooms, we love the idea of optional meal plan because on 5th Ave there are lots of international restaurants it is a must to eat out at night, we drive up from Belize it's nice to visit the attractions and get around at your own pace , the beaches are beautiful. Fel Williams

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Sunset Fishermen, Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Deana N
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome, right on the beach, so if you like to swim in the ocean this is a great spot. We found the food to be average and kind of high-priced, but we did alot of cooking in our room which saved $$. This is an older facility, and we had a couple of problems in our room; they had to completely replace our toilet, and our safe stopped working (just a battery, but kind of a pain anyway). But the staff is helpful and friendly, there are fun daily activities, and the proximity to the ocean (stone's throw from the balcony) make up for a lot.

Reviews.Title: “OUR FAVORITE PLACE ON THE YUCATAN”
Reviews.Author: hunkydory25
Reviews.Content: We look forward all year to two weeks at Fishermen's! It is like going home..from year to year, Marcial recognizes us and welcomes us by name. Luis is always waiting to welcome everyone and in my case, has the cribbage board ready. They are all like family. The hotel itself is wonderful, always clean and so close for walking to town to enjoy all the other wonderful things about Playa del Carmen. The food is not the best, but the jugo verde is by far the most delicious and nutritious I have had (and I try it everywhere). The small size of the facility is perfect for families with children as you always know where they are and even the staff helps keep track of them! I highly recommend it, but don't take my two weeks! Sra. Judy

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home, private beach and condo among million dollar homes”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in December of '11 and absolutely loved everything about this place. From the super-friendly and helpful staff to the immaculate grounds, incredible beach, comfortable rooms, the stories of the people you meet and even the food. We opted to only do the meal plan for a couple of days b/c we really love to walk into Playa to some of the other restuarants, but the meal plan does allow you to not worry about a thing except if you have enough sunscreen on. What I love about this place is it's size and location. There's only like 40-some units so it's not too big. I know some resorts are so big it takes 5-10 minutes to get from your room to the beach. Here, I walked about my backdoor and stepped over a small wall and there I was. Not sure how you can beat that. Also b/c it's small you get to know other travellers and it becomes a friendly and family type athmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Sunset Fishermen's host our first family vacation Dec 2011”
Reviews.Author: Kendra M
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico and we had not formed any preconceived expectations. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and great welcomes from the bell hop and entertainment organizers...thanks Marcial and Luis!! We enjoyed our time at this resort but had trouble with the meal plan. We found it very expensive and the food was very inconsistent. Breakfast buffets were reasonable but lunch and dinner were of poor quality. Drinks were prepared in styrofoam cups if you were not remaining at the bar and I had so hoped for authentic drinks not prepared with high sugar syrup additives. Those of us that took part in the meal plan all experienced some tummy troubles, compared to our extended family that chose to eat at the local restaurants in Playa del Carmen and did not have any issues. The kids loved the pool and we had great accessibilty to snorkel gear, kayaks, bikes (some in poor repair) etc. Our only other concern was the smell we frequently noticed when walking along the beach...We are not sure of the sanitation system protocols in the area but depending on the direction of the prevailing winds some smells of waste were offensive. Every morning the beaches were raked, walkways cleaned and swept and floors were constantly mopped throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo Hotel In a Great Location Right on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Blaine1953
Reviews.Content: How could you ask for more. This condo hotel resort is located right on the beach with all services that can be desired on a Caribbean vacation. We have spend numerous weeks at this resort and find it to be very popular as it is usually fully booked and over booked. Most guests and members book a year in advance to get the week they want. That has to say something about the popularity of this condo hotel. I would rate it a very high quality 3-star or low 4 star. It is very clean and service is excellent as it is owned by a very prominent resort company called Sunset Group. The property is well maintained and managed. The lobby and guest rooms have recently undergone $5 mil in improvements and refurbishments. The timeshare members and RCI guests will be delighted to see the new furniture and up-date rooms. If high-end meals are important look elsewhere as you will find the presentation and service very good but only average in flavor and quality at Fishermens. You get what you pay for no matter where you travel. Fishermens offers an economical meal plan as compared to other resorts that charge as much as $125 usd per person per day for food and booze. I go to Mexico for the beach and sun (R&R). The food and booze is second on my list of measuring value. This condo hotel offers great accomodation in a safe location (Playacar phase 1) within walking distance of 5th avenue. You cant go wrong - book early!! Blaine - Wendy Calgary

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo stay away from the time share sharks”
Reviews.Author: traveler150207
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Away from the crowds but close enough to walk to downtown. The all inclusive option is not worth it. Eat at the local places downtown. Pool and beach are well maintained. Give the timeshare sharks a firm NO and they will leave you alone.

Reviews.Title: “On a great beach and a wonderful place for families - we love it!”
Reviews.Author: Ty D
Reviews.Content: Since 2007, my wife, two boys and I have spent one or two weeks at Fisherman's every year. Simply put, we love it! The hotel is relatively small, right on a beautiful beach (one of the best in the Playa area) and is about a 10 minute walk from the start of 5th Avenue in Playa. Although the hotel is not as modern as other hotels in the region, the rooms are quite nice and the are comfortable and clean. We expect that the planned renovations to the rooms will make the rooms more modern and comfortable within the next year. Finally, the staff is very friendly and helpful and they do a very good job of making sure guests enjoy their stay. As frequent guests at the hotel, we have to agree with other reviewers who have stated that the food at the resort is not very good. With that said, since all inclusive service is optional and the hotel is so close to stores and restaurants, we don't really see any need to purchase the all inclusive option, even if you have children.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: rlquiroz
Reviews.Content: My husband and i went down to Playa del Carmen for our "second honey moon" . We were not going down there with high expectations after readying the reviews, but i must say that it was beautiful. The place is small , only 60 rooms so if you are looking for something quiet this is the place for you. The food was.... OK.... you dont have that many options so it becomes repetitive same desserts and menus every day. Also, you only have two restaurants to choose from. As far as alcohol, i am not a good source since i dont drink that much so i didnt even know what i was missing hahaha. you get to kayak, snarkel (sp?) check out books, games etc for free so that was fun. The beach is absolutely beautiful and you can walk to a really nice long road full of gift shops , restaurants and night life if thats your choice . OH!! and how can i forget, many women walk around topless lol which if you are a conservative and newly wed you might not enjoy this place, i would recomend Hacienda Tres Rios, EXCELLENTTT!!!! 5 restaurants , excellent pools etc BUT the beach is not pretty at all - so choose wisely and as everyone says STAY AWAY FROM BUYING TIMESHARES :)

Reviews.Title: “We had a fantastic time and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: sarahanne1
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we were a bit worried but these people must have stayed at a different resort. The hotel is built on the beach, the beach beds are amazing, we always managed to get an umbrella and the double beds have a roof cover so there is plenty of shelter. The beach is cleaned every morning and ours was definately the cleanest beach compared to other hotels. There are 2 bars, one in the lobby and one at the pool, the beer and spirits were good and the cocktails were fantastic, try the Riviera Maya! We ate in the buffet restaurant a couple of times at night but tended to go to the Italian which is on the beach, the food here was cooked to order and was better than the buffet, Carlos the waiter in her was great, ask him to make a Mayan coffee, it's quite spectacular. Breakfast was fine, buffet style so it does get a bit repetitive but the freshly cooked omlettes were great and if you ask Geronimo he will get the chef to cook you a Mexican breakfast which was really nice. Our room was excellent, we had a sea view, a jacuzzi on the balcony, cleaned very well daily and if you want the coffee replacing in your room just ask reception, it was there before we got back to our room. We were asked once if we wanted to visit the new RCI resort and when we said no we were just wanting a relaxing holiday we were never asked again. The resort is a 15 minute walk to Fifth Avenue either on the beach or the streets, which are more sheltered. There is a restaurant just before you get to the shopping centre if you walk on the road called Xulam which was fantastic, we stopped there a few times for cocktails and once for a meal. We did a few trips, Coba and Mayan Village which was good but once we had been to Chichen Itza we would recommend this rather than doing both. Xcaret was ok, but couldn't get round it all in the time we had available and wished we hadn't booked the night show as that wasn't so good. We had a great time and were sad to leave, don't worry about the bad reviews on here, those people obviously spend their holiday looking for faults instead of enjoying themselves.

Reviews.Title: “They made more improvements!”
Reviews.Author: 4Travelling
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to see they added beach beds at the shore line! They don't get a lot of shade but if you are there at the right time, you'll get shade. This is a small boutique hotel with 60 rooms. The property needs refurbishing and they told me this will start late this year. I hope they add ramps for wheel chairs because it's hard to get my Mom in the room. I've been there when it rains and the top floors leak... I had a studio and it was perfect... a nice big bed, table and 4 chairs, 2 stove tops a couch and chairs in the balcony. I love my coffee in the balcony... some have a jacuzzi in the balcony but sometimes it doesn't work. The staff is very nice... the head bartender needs to smile even if he doesn't get the big tips, LOL... I noticed how nice he was at those that gave him $10 or $20s but not too friendly to the rest of us. You are not there for the liquor or the food... except, I have to say that I enjoyed the dinners... which were about $40 including 2 glasses of wine. The "all inclusive" is not worth it because you will not drink that much... not good liquor. The a-la-carte prices were good... Buffet was $16 and I had plenty of fruit and eggs any way I wanted them and a latte! They have a welcome buffet on Saturdays and of course, try to get you to a time share presentation but it was not pushed. On Sundays, they have a Fiesta with Mariachis... very small but it's nice. By Thursday you know your neighbors and it's like being at home... on Friday, you are sad you are leaving the next day. When I got there, my room was ready early afternoon and I really appreciated it... it was a long flight and I couldn't wait to get in... I was missing some things in the room but I called and they immediately got it to me. The Staff is wonderful. They even had turn down service this time! The activities director keeps you busy if you want... and he is great with kids... always playing some group game. The pool is small but you can stand over the infinity point and stare at the beautiful ocean... which is the best ocean in Playa! I love being in a neighborhood and only a few minutes away from shops and restaurants... if you walk along the beach, you will get there faster and it's cooler. You are also close to the Conzumel ferry, which makes it very convenient. The hotel has a free shuttle to town at 9:30am and 11:30am... they also have free wifi in the lobby area. The beach is what wins all my points... it's nice and when it doesn't rain, it's clear and like bath water... you see people in the water at 7am! Sunset is wonderful... the sky has so many colors... just lovely! I had a full body massage outside and it was so relaxing... Vicki is great. I should have had one when I first arrived and one on the last day... you feel like floating! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “We loved and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Unhappy070
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week and had a wonderful time. Personell and service were outstanding, rooms large and clean. The pool and the beach wonderful, food was great and the service excellent They really make sure you have a good time. Walking distance to 5th Avenue Mall. We will be back soon, Small resort but excellent in everyway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Location”
Reviews.Author: sueUtah
Reviews.Content: Lots of mixed reviews on this location. First, loved location, walking distance to 5th ave by beach or street. Hotel was clean and very well maintained. Daily room service was great. Enjoyed the pool and pool bar. Great beach with equally great chairs, beds, etc on beach. Staff friendly and helpful. Weird about cashing travelers checks, advise just taking all your money in pecos, much easier. They only wanted to cash 50.00 a day in Travelers checks but I usually convienced them to cash a 100 for me. ok, now the food thing. We had to pay $70.00 something per day per person for breakfast and either lunch or dinner. Breakfast buffet was ok, but sometimes the fruit was too old, came out day after day. Was not appealing when looking old. Staff prepared fresh omelets, that was the best. I think we only had one or two lunches, odd menu that never changed. Choice of like 4 things, no mexican food. Now to dinner. Dinner is sit down, menu style. While the food was very good, it generally took 2 hours to complete. Not an exaggeration! There is some disconnect here between kitchen and wait staff. It would be 30 min or more between courses. Way too slow!!! Also traveling with vegitarians and never a choice on menu for them but I will say the staff tried really hard to arrange something. All in all we loved our stay. Beautiful property and location, people were fabulous. Just better eating other places.............

Reviews.Title: “"All Inclusive" is FAR from really being all inclusive”
Reviews.Author: Hammons
Reviews.Content: Before you choose this place to stay, and pay the "all inclusive" price, you need to know that the only beer is Modelo on tap (which gets hot FAST) and they carry NO top shelf liquors. We had to go into town to buy American beer that we could drink!! Food was horrible!! Now, other than that (which was a biggie for us), the place is beautiful, quiet, small, and the folks we met that were vacationing also were wonderful!! Housekeepers did a great job cleaning the room, but did not replace the coffee for the coffee maker, took the coffee cups each day and never replaced them. Little things that you take for granted that housekeepers would do - they were very slack about. The beach is the most beautiful beach I've ever seen and they have great beach furniture. Will NOT stay there again!! Believe me - I'll make sure I check into what "all inclusive" means next year!! We paid $1,022 for basically nothing!! Also very disappointed that the staff spoke extremely poor English. I realize we've visiting their country, but for this to be a tourist attraction for people from all over the world, I'd expect them to speak a little better English. Other resorts we've visited in Mexico had staff that spoke extremely good English.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Ingy52
Reviews.Content: First, cudos to the Staff. They were amiable and attentive. Our problem was with the food and Liquor we had at the resort. We were told we had to sign up for the "all inclusive" program. Usually that is what we prefer, but the food and Liquor at the Hotel were less than satisfactory! We spoke to the Staff, including the "Executive Chef" but neither area improved. We will not stay at this resort in the future if it is still mandatory that we have the "all inclusive"!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation I've ever had...”
Reviews.Author: Happy20512
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Resort, everyone was so friendly. Picture the perfect vacation in your head -- that's what this was. I was in heaven. The staff were wonderful, the rooms were peaceful and had everything you could need or want, dishes, a sitting area, comfortable beds and good-sized rooms, etc. The food was tasty despite other reviews I read. I think this resort really works hard at giving their customers a dream vacation, and that's exactly what they gave to me. I can't wait to go back. I also got a spa treatment, and it was wonderful as well -- a nice, relaxing massage looking out on the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small resort”
Reviews.Author: cjripley
Reviews.Content: We stayed their march 19 to 26th. It was a very nice small resort. If you want nightly shows or a hopping nightlife this is not the resort for you. But if you just want to hang out by the beach or the 4 ft pool and then this might be for you. Lots of seating and don't have to worry about getting up at 5am to get a seat. Its a nice 15 min walk from town. The food could use some work but we just mainly ate the breakfast there. They have a fantastic omlet bar. You can choose to go all inclusive if you want. 41 usd for just breakfast and drinks all day. Or you can choose the 55 dollar package for breakfast lunch or dinner and drinks. The service was great. Bartenders were very helpful. The bar is only open from 10 am to 1030pm. The rooms were very clean. It looked as if the housekeeping staff sanitized the room and changed sheets every day. They even washed our dishes. I brushed my teeth with tap water all week. Shower had good pressure and we were on the third floor. Overall we had a great week and I would go back there again tommorow if I could.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff makes Sunset Fishermen”
Reviews.Author: hkap81
Reviews.Content: Here are some bullet points of pros and cons at Sunset Fishermen - location is great. It is right on a beautiful beach is and a 12-15 minute walk to the shopping/restuarants at Playa del Carmen. You can either walk on the beach or walk on the road. They will also call a taxi for you if you'd like which is $5 into town. They also have bikes available to use. - While we were there, the marjority of the crowd was over the age of 50. Which is a pro because everything quiets down really early. But if you are young honeymooners like us, you may feel like you are in a retirement community. - The staff is excellent. They are super friendly and helpful. the maid would make these little creatures out of bath towels each day and place on our bed. The bartenders always made good drinks. - The food for lunch and dinner can use some help. Breakfast buffet is good with a lot of suggestions. The lunch isn't too desirable but if you ask they will make you something else. The chef was really nice. The dinner buffets were okay. - They have free internet access but only in the lobby. The complex is not very big and I wish that they could expand it to all the rooms. - The swimming pool is cold but i've heard most resorts in the area do not heat their pools. - they have kayaks, snorkel gear, and boogie boards for use.

Reviews.Title: “OK.. not bad... a little secluded but quiet”
Reviews.Author: mrputtputt
Reviews.Content: This our 2nd stay at Sunset Fishermen, unfortunately we are members that got suckered into buying a timeshare in 2006 (which I cannot offload w/o a HUGE loss). My wife does like it though because it is a little secluded and quiet. The beach this time is much better than it was in 2008, back when they had sandbags to prevent further erosion of the beach). Now, Mexico put so much sand back into the beach that it is much, much wider and they removed the barriers between the different resorts. So now, you can walk all the way down to the port to Cozumel (yes, there is actually a beach now in front of the hotel/resorts by the port!) or all the way the other side to Riu or Sandos. We did not opt for the all inclusive given we think 1) it's not of any value when you're paying $55 or so per day but only have 2 meals - breakfast and dinner and 2) there is nothing much else to be had with the all-inclusive. The food is so-so but this 2nd time around, we ate in town for authentic mexican food and for much cheaper too (recommend la mission a block off 5th ave which is another locaiton from the Cozumel branch). There is a pool but small. There is a small gym and a spa but usually for members only. The steam room wasn't working this time around though. There is also a jacuzzi (cold and hot) just outside the gym as part of the spa. Where I am displeased with Sunset though is the inconsistency of information. We were moving to Tres Rios after our 1 week stay in Sunset Fishermen and though they can provide us a shuttle ride to the Tres Rios (sister resort and a much, MUCH more expensive one). 3 people we spoke with said no but we met another couple doing the same move to Tres Rios and they said 1 of the concierge arranged transporation for them. I'm pretty miffed by that since it's a $20 cab ride 1-way to Tres Rios. If it wasn't for my SO not feeling well, I would've taken the offer to share the free ride with the other couple, who were members also with another sister resort Sunset Royal. Wi-fi is only in the lobby, which sucks. But at least that is more consistent and on than Tres Rios (who's wifi is all over but very spotty and always disconnects/resets). There are not too many kids but there are families that come visit. It's mainly a lot of older folks (late 40s-50's) and families that show up. We usually just walk to town (15 min leisure walk) and there is not much traffic in Playacar. If you're looking for a quiet/secluded resort, this is probably it. It's kinda old school w/o LCD tv's. Some cable channels in American. You have to get used to a 1/2 glass cover for the shower. It is a no-frills type resort but the great news is they actually have snorkling gear to use, unlike it's more expensive sister Tres Rios that had ZERO snorkling gear (even just fins) if you wanted to snorkle out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Friendly atomosphere”
Reviews.Author: jasonlcms
Reviews.Content: We arrived and brought tropical storm Alex with us. We were told that our transfer from the airport was covered but found out that it wasn't. Our room was nice two huge king beds and a pull out sofa, with a jacuzzi off our balcony. We had lots of rain and wind the first couple of days that blew in through our sliding glass doors. The food was limited but everything we had was really good. The service was great, everyone was very friendly including Luis, the activity director. We had two children with us and felt safe with them at that resort. Tip get pesos before you go, the exchange rate at our airport was 14.85 to 1 us. The rates there ranged from 12 - 10 to 1. The beach was beautiful, the water was blue but the visibility of the water was limited due to Alex. Some minor points - they ran out of some minor amenities half way through the week.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Sharks”
Reviews.Author: scammedbrit
Reviews.Content: Anybody getting off the plane at Cancun or Cozumel avoid the smiling offers of free breakfasts/discounted car hire/snorkelling trips. You are being surrounded by the lesser sharks of the Sunset Group who are intent on robbing you blind and lining their pockets. If you are foolish enough to sign up for the "90 minute" presentation then be prepared to be literally detained for up to 6 hours while the salesmen sharks grind you down and play psycholgical games with their promises of cheap weeks and special deals. If you are jet-lagged as we were then expect to leave at least £1000 poorer with a fairly useless "contract" . Dont even think about using the 5 day opt out, they will have extracted the cash from your credit card account within minutes of your signing up. Your "executive weeks" will be in hurricane or low season will cost significantly more than the promised figures and be totally useless in any case if you are limited as to when you can take a vacation during the year. AVOID AVOID AVOID Sunset Group are CROOKS and LIARS. The beach at this place is pretty awful also compared to places elsewhere in Playa and further south.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: WhyEverNot
Reviews.Content: We found Sunset Fishermen after being advised to visit the hotel by the VIP manager at Hacienda Tres Rios and we were so glad we did. When you walk in through the double wide open front doors and see the beautiful mermaid sculpture with the pool in the distance and the white sand and beautiful water beyond you'd think you had gone back in time 20 years. My friend and I spend everyday afterward at Fishermen. It was exactly what we had been looking for in a resort. Yes it is older but you really get the flavor of Mexico and because it is smaller, the customer service was fantastic and personal. We had lobster dinner that was fabulous and ate breakfast and lunch there as well. Everything was excellent....

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Lies and Deceptions!”
Reviews.Author: diane_rains
Reviews.Content: Positives: Small size Beautiful location Well-kept common areas Mostly friendly staff. Negatives: Lies and deceptions from warm and friendly sales people who are very good at what they do...convincing people to buy immediately Poor availability of weeks when you want to visit "Use or lose" policy on free/bonus weeks even if no weeks are available at all Increasing maintenance charges while room maintenance deteriorates Little to no help with concerns expressed to the on-site manager 20 minute minimum walk to get out of the Village We have been owners for a few years now and the situation is always the same.... upon arrival you are shuttled into a room for lunch where you are given "another" sales pitch selling their food and drink program and "upgrades" to your current ownership status. Only after this are you allowed to go to the room you are assigned. This time, we did not agree to purchase anything additional. The room we were assigned to was off to the side of the building with a limited view. Within moments, I noticed that we had no hot water and the bathroom window had a broken frame. I reported this immediately and was told it would be taken care of tomorrow. I called back the next afternoon and asked when the repairs would be done. They sent a man up to look at it and then he left. I called again and was told it would be taken care of soon. We went the entire week without hot water or a window that opened. The lack of hot water combined with next to no water pressure and a plugged drain also made the spa on the balcony impossible to use as well. Another issue was the hot tub in the swimming area. It had a sign that clearly stated no children allowed. Yet many 3-4 year olds played in the hot tub alone, while their parents read books in their lounge chairs. When this was pointed out to the staff, they said they would enforce the rules. They never did.The children were never asked to leave an were back in the tub each of the following days. I did not use it because it was impossible to relax with the kids splashing, yelling and I was also concerned about how much pee was in that tub! Our king size bed was actually two beds put together. The sheets were too short and did not cover the entire mattress. I asked for proper fitting sheets, but they were never provided. After a while the management got tired of my concerns and would just hang up or disconnect me when I called for service. BOTTOM LINE Don't count on getting what you are told you will at Fisherman's Village!

Reviews.Title: “WOW....I admit they are good at stealing your money”
Reviews.Author: donnyb_08
Reviews.Content: well this adventure started in May 2008 while trying to get out of the airport we were surprised with venders trying to sell us timeshares. "just say no" or your will end up like me going to SUNSET FISHERMEN'S RESORT, and listening to there sales pitch which lasted for 2-3 hours. I finally had enough and started to leave when there was one more trick up there sleeve as they sent the top dog out "JUAN CARLOS MORALES" as he talked me into a 10 week agreement for the mere price of 3,000 US DOLLARS. I have tried to cancel this agreement and haven't received any responses. I have decided to try to use the membership I purchase and every time I talk to a salesman through the VIP-TRAVEL CLUB network the extra amount of money it would cost for food etc..would cost considerably more than I paid for the membership..This Cancum experience was a wake up call on how these destinations do business. PLEASE BE CAUTIOUS OR YOU WILL BE WRITING THIS MESSAGE..THANKS

Reviews.Title: “We love it!”
Reviews.Author: WineHarbour
Reviews.Content: I read some of the negative reviews and wonder if these people have stayed at the same place as my husband and I have. We are seniors who have travelled extensively and for many years have owned time-share on a Caribbean Island so we believe we can do a good comparison. The resort is small and perfectly located as near the beach as possible. The staff is friendly and always helpful. The units are clean and well maintained, with daily maid service, although some do need upgrading. We understand that that there are plans to do that over the next year or two. We do not take the all-inclusive but we have had several very good breakfasts and al la carte dinners. If one wants a noisy place with loud night-life the Fishermen is not for you but if you stay there you are only a short distance from Avinida Quinta with lots of restaurants, clubs, shops and activity. We can't wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: brent3691
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 8 friends. The accommodations, food, spa, pool area and staff were excellent. We enjoyed the quaintness of the resort, and the festivities of nearby Playa del Carmen and Cozumel. The staff members were attentive and fun. We were pleasantly surprised by the continued attention given to the property post Tres Rios. We enjoyed the reduced traffic through the resort. The lunch menu was greatly improved since our last visit. We recommend improving the Italian restaurant menu/quality and adding wireless internet service to the rooms. We understand the owner is planning to address some upgrades in the near future. The living room furniture is needing an update. Thanks for a great vacation. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Paradise on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Champ888
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fisherman's Village with our 16 year old daughter, 15 year old friend and our 5 year son. We had a great time, they loved it. The hotel is located 15 minute walk to Fifth Avenue where all the shopping and restaurants are. We didn't buy into the all inclusive, that is why we bought this time share because it was not mandatory that we buy the all inclusive meal plan. We bought food some days and cooked in our room, the rooms have a full size fridge and a two burner stove, it was great when we were tired and didn't want to walk up to Fifth Avenue. We enjoyed the volleyball that was played in pool daily. They had activities for the kids to keep them busy and out of trouble. It is a perfect size resort and it was quiet for a week of relaxing by the pool or on the beach. We found the hotel perfect for us, we don't like the over sized ones, too many people in the pool and people holding loungers.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought at Fisherman's Village years ago. We have travelled all over the world and this is by far our favourite little piece of Heaven. We also own a unit in Cancun and go there before we come for our two weeks here! There is absolutely no comparison! Cancun, while lovely, is like any large city, and is a hot spot for spring breakers. Playa del Carmen is a lovely small village, which still has the majic of Mexico. The staff at Fisherman's Village are amazing! Jose Luis, Luis and Lanny go the extra mile on each and every request. We love this place so much that we are going in October to celebrate my husband's birthday with his children and grandchildren! We could think of no better place to be surrounded by friends and family. As owners, you do not have to buy the meal plan. However, we do as it is a reasonable price. Fisherman's Village is a wonderful, intimate place to vacation and where else can you have the ocean right at your toes!! We have met many new friends whom we see each year. For those of who want more or a larger facility, there is the beautiful new Tres Rios. Jose Luis would be more than happy to take you on a tour.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Food!”
Reviews.Author: Littletaby1729
Reviews.Content: We own a timeshare with the Sunset group which is a ripoff. Don't get sucked in since we have owned all we have gotten from them is excuses. The Fishermen is a smaller resort which was nice there were not many people there so that was nice. The food was the worst part of the trip. The menu is the same everyday!!! It never changes and there are no other restaurants in the hotel! The meal plan is expensive and not worth it. In addition to their menu not changing when we would order something they would be out of it and we had to order something different. We stayed in a studio with a pull out couch and it was disguisting there were stains all over it and they didn't not even provide a sheet to put over it. Their bar closes at 10:30 p.m. and it is a small resort so we went to bed early because there was nothing left do to after 10:30 p.m unless we went out. Overall our experiences with the Sunset have been terrible. For the amount of money we paid at this resort we could have gone to a nicer one run by a better company.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: visitorjl
Reviews.Content: this is a small hotel they have had a bad rap in the past the food was good, the beach is private, staff friendly lots to do they said next year is remodel time

Reviews.Title: “Badly in need of upgrades”
Reviews.Author: Moriarte
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Fishermen with our friends who have a week timeshare there. The place is badly in need of repairs, upgrades, maintenance,and furnishings. The kitchen supplies were dismal. The furniture falling apart literally. Some of the staff were very nice however Lenny who seems to run the place is quite the hard nosed, don't give an inch type of person. We had to change units 3 times as the first 2 were smelly and in bad shape. Lenny was rude to me when I asked her why she didn't give us the massage gifts for going to the time share presentation. She said we just didn't ask hard enough and it was too late to do anything. She had the power to do what she wanted and just refused to budge an inch. The time share presentation at Tres Rios was awful. They were only interested in was getting our friends to trade in their 3 weeks for Tres Rios. Tres Rios could be beautiful but they are deeply in debt and it seems implausible that they could possibly finish it given the current economic conditions. Something "Fishy" is going on there. That is the last time I will ever go to one of these presentations. They are down right awful. I did have a massage which was ok and my friend had one by the same person after me and came out with bruises and said it was the worst massage she had ever had. Don't bother staying here unless things change

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: loririchh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this condo resort (alternatively called Sunset Fisherman and Fisherman's Village) during our kids spring break. We rented the only 4 bedroom unit in the resort from a rental company called Ocean Summit Travel. We were two families; my family of 2 adults and 3 kids (9, 13, 15) and my in-law's family of 2 adults and 2 kids (13, 15). Overall, this resort worked great for us, thanks in great part to the facilities and staff at Fisherman's as well as the other owners/guests at the resort. As some background, we had traveled with the same group during spring break for the previous two years, once in Mazatlan and once in Puerto Vallarta. Everyone agreed that, while we really enjoyed those vacations, this was the best. Our unit (#334) was on the third floor (no elevator) and was on two levels, with two master suites (with king size beds) upstairs on the sea side of the unit so you could open your window at night and hear the roar of the waves. The main level had two other bedrooms but not on the sea side of the unit. The kitchen was great; big fridge, dishwasher, microwave, stove/oven and a 5 gallon water dispenser, which the maid service replace each time they cleaned our room. It had a flat screen tv in the living room (also tvs in one master an one guest suite). One of the owners told us that this unit recently sold for $600k. It was very nice. Much of what made this vacation great was due to the resort. The resort is small by comparison to previous resorts we've stayed at and, in many ways, is probably why we enjoyed it so much. The resort offers a small restaurant (which we only ate lunch at a couple of times), a bar, a smaller pool, large hot tub, smaller beach, concierge desk and an activities desk that offers daily activities (water volleyball, bike tours, salsa dancing, etc) free boogie boards and bikes. The small size of the resort allowed us to participate in much of the activities. The However the staff really made the difference. We all got a kick out of the one man entertainment dynamo by the name of Sergio. Sergio is a young guy who leads seemingly all the activities such as water volleyball, aerobics, yoga, salsa dancing, and bartending class. He was so nice to all the kids, even playing cards with them for hours. He even served as a lifeguard when some got caught in a riptide during a windy day and was too exhausted to swim back in. The rest of the staff was very friendly and helpful. The resort is about a 15 minute walk to 5th Ave in Playacar. We found that our routine was to go for a morning walk through the Mayan ruins and to the main road where the all-inclusive hotels are on, go the pool/beach during the day, get a taxi ride to a restaurant somewhere ($5-7 per taxi). After dinner, we'd explore 5th Ave and then walk home, working off our large meals in the process. We made use of the Spa services on site; having a massage outside while the waves crashed on shore was very relaxing. The bikes were ok; some were in bad shape and not comfortable to ride - they could use to upgrade these bikes. On past vacations it was rare if we got to know any of the other guests at the hotel we were staying; at Fisherman's there were so many friendly owners/guests. Many of them were older/retired who had bought at Fisherman's when it was built 15 or so years ago. They all knew Playa well and loved to share their favorite restaurant or place to visit in Playa. If I had to list some cons to the resort I'd have to mention the beach, which was not very good while we were there, apparently because of the direction the wind had been blowing for the last couple of weeks. The sand bags in the water detract slightly to the beautiful Caribbean Sea. The pool is not large by any means but my kids didn't complain once about it. Overall, this place was perfect for us and I anticipate that we will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Buy!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jack5050
Reviews.Content: DO NOT GET FOOLED ! We listened to biggest line of bull by the craftiest, most sincere sounding sales people to get us to purchase. Oh what a fool I feel like now. We were on our honeymoon in Playa and went to the resort and believed the line of crap that was told to us. Yes you can have any week you want, except holidays, well, the first time we try to reserve we were rejected. We were promised any week in April or May since we told the sales person we could only vacation in those months. NOT ! DON'T GO ! DON'T BUY !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We love this resort but also drank the koolaid and purchased. Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: iaqcweber
Reviews.Content: If its any consolation we were duped as well. I consider this my "dirty little secret" since I am so embarrassed to have been so stupid. Having said that we love the resort, and have stayed there many times. Love the location and the size and we are treated well there. Am wondering if that will change now that we are "paid up". Have only gotten our one bedroom one time and have stayed in the studios all others. Lies and decpetion don't accurately describe....we have never tried to get out of the deal-paid $18K for one platinum week and 4 "bonus weeks". But bottom line is this-we could have stayed here almost any time we wanted I suppose just by booking it thru an agent. If you are smart enuf to be reading this before you go. JUST SAY NO.

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear of the Time Share Trap”
Reviews.Author: SoundsFishy
Reviews.Content: Time Share Lies, Fraud and Deception: Since our story is similar to hundreds of others that can be found on the internet, I will try to be brief. While on vacation celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary with our 2 young children; we were approached upon our arrival at the airport in Cancun and offered free attraction tickets in return for a $40 deposit and listening to a 90 minute time share presentation at Sunset Fishermans Village in Playa Del Carmen. They picked us up at our hotel and held us hostage for 7 hours of lies and high pressure sales tactics at their beautiful, small (and curiously uninhabited) resort with a view of the island of Cozumel. We were "guaranteed" a good investment, rental income and easy availability. They even threw in a 2 year membership to RCI and 4 RCI bonus weeks! We in return, threw away $14, 000 of our hard earned money. Please - don't send any comments telling us how stupid we are - we know!In October of 2007 we attempted to reserve any winter week in 2008 and were told that there was absolutely no availability until May. We were offered a studio for one week (when we had purchased a one bedroom) or "mandatory all inclusive" in Cancun. The studio was out of the question with 2 kids and their all inclusive in Cancun (not Playa Del Carmen where we had bought) was way overpriced. We could have gone to a 5 star all inclusive for less money! Our calls and emails have been mostly ignored by Sunset Group. A letter from our attorney was also ignored. We have filed a complaint with Profeco, the government agency who act as mediators. Profeco will have 3 meetings with the company in Mexico before closing the file (possibly as unresolved). The first meeting took place on November 4th but we were not invited. Sunset Group made us an "offer of cancelling our contract without a refund, we have declined their offer. They are now threateaning us with a US collection agency for 2008 maintenance fees when we were refused a reservation in 2008!We have contacted Mastercard, RCI, the Mexican Embassy in Canada and the Canadian Embassy in Mexico since we beleive that they all have a duty and obligation to warn tourists about Sunset Group and it's fraudulent practices.Has anyone had any success with obtaining a refund from these banditos? Is a class action possible (from Canada) and has anyone had any success with obtaining a refund outside of the 5 day waiver period? Please constructive responses only...thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Why WE love the Sunset Fishermens”
Reviews.Author: norman_bates_sr
Reviews.Content: We own 3 Platinum, 2 BR weeks. We traded in a 4th week in a deal to buy into the new Trés Rios resort. We love watching the progress of the construction at Trés Rios (opening scheduled for Nov. or Dec. I believe). We bought in because of the GREAT accommodations, treatment, staff, cleanliness, beach.and overall ambiance. As with any resort, there are things that can be improved and are a work in progress. Management is on the ball. There are some large sandbags on the beach to fight erosion, but they also form a large, safe bathing area, especially for children. Our G'kids LOVE the resort, They love the beach and the pool. On of our youngest (6) loves to swim up to the bar and "Hola, Pina Colada sin alcohol por favor" No need to speak Spanish as all of the service staff with direct contact with guests are fluent in English. Frequent water volley ball games with mixed groups of English and Spanish speaking guests are great fun.

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear.”
Reviews.Author: wsrgraphics
Reviews.Content: Us: We're pretty seasoned travelers (Thailand, Laos, Cambodia, India, Australia, NZ, FIji Central America etc). Usually backpacking, but recently brought it up a level for our honeymoon. Sunset Fishermans: Were stopped in the airport by people flogging 'tours' of Sunset Fishermans Resort. Knew it was a scam of sorts, but listened to the schtick, and figured we could use the free dives offered and the free pickup from our resort to our advantage - which all worked out well. Were promised a 90 minute presentation which went on for about 120 minutes. It was actually ok, but by the 20 minute mark, we were sure we weren't interested. We told them honestly, but listened to the rest of the presentations. By 90 minutes, we were all sure there wasn't goign to be a sale. But we still had to sit through a second sale pitch from a sales manager who was 'also from or home town' and a third really aggressive sales man who called us liars for wasting the previous two salesmens' time. By the end we were really put off and felt very uncomfortable. We got all the stuff promised to us but the aggressive sales pitch at the end was really terrible. Unless you can handle the abuse, and have 2 hours to spare, I'd recommend steering clear of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Kristyn_8
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from the most relaxing, breathtaking, holiday we have ever had. The place we stayed was "sunset Fisherman Resort., and it can only be described as Paradise. We have two children aged 7 & 8, and I would recommend this resort to anyone with young children. It is so safe. The beach is about two steps away from the pool, so us parents could just relax in one place and watch from a distance and enjoy. The Staff were so friendly and could not do enough to make our stay stress free. We got to know them all by name, and have taken away with us some great photos of them all. The rooms were much more than we expected. Large suites with marble floors and bath surround. Very clean. The maid would come twice a day to fix our room. Once to make the beds and tidy. Then later in the day would be the night service where she would turn down the bed and leave us candy on the pillow. Always plenty of towels and fresh stock of shampoo etc. There is great shopping only 15 minutes walk away to the famous 5th Avenue. They expect you to bargain so do not be shy you can get some good deals especially in the Silver Shops. The Fisherman has Six to Eight vans that leave the resort every 15 minutes to take you where ever you want free of charge. You might want to do this especially in July when it is so hot. That 15 mins. walk to 5th Ave. seems like an hour. The food is amazing, but if it is too spicy for the children they will always make them a Burger or Pizza, or something more for their taste. My children enjoyed trying the different Mexican foods. Since I have been back I have read some of the reviews, and really can not believe some of the negative reviews. some of them were absolutely not true. Especially about the shuttles to and from places. For what we wanted the Sunset Fisherman Resort gave us all we needed and more. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a quiet relaxing vacation in paradise. Maybe not for the young party group who are looking for great night entertainment. We would return again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It”
Reviews.Author: ciaobella99
Reviews.Content: First, upon arrival when all you really want is a shower, you are made to stay in the lobby for 10 minutes, then you are shown to a dining area where you wait another 20. Then, immediately, comes the sales pitch...upgrade to this or buy that. You MUST have the meal plan...anything they can sell you. The meal plan is a rip off as the food is TERRIBLE. Buffet every day. You could never drink and eat the $55 a day they charge for two meals. The drinks come in dinky little plastic cups with very little alcohol. TIP: walk into town for meals. There are plenty of good restaurants. Then, the constant stream of salesmen and potential suckers streaming from the lobby to the pool and up into the bowel of the sales room (which is god awful). I accompanied a friend and was aghast at the heavy sales pitching going on all around me. The culmination of this pitch is the popping of a bottle of sparkling wine for those who are crazy enough to buy in. UGH. The staff, although lovely, was not helpful. They did not work well together as a team. Nobady knew, eg, where the luggage storage was and we were mistakenly woken up at 7 a.m. for a trip that they had previously cancelled for us. The salesman whom I refused was rude, turning my declination of buying a timeshare into a personal attack. The concierge was loud and brassy and outright lied when it came to prices of tours. We were, for example, promised four FREE tickets to trips and then made to pay $35 each for the "additional all-inclusive mandatory" fee. All said and done, if you are interested in Mexico, its culture, its people, the Mayan culture, food, etc, DON'T stay here. Buy a good guide book and book a hotel, eat out, do the tours on your own (you'll save a bunch of cash.) Another tip: don't take their $40 shuttle to and from the airport. The public bus (ADO) is $9 each way and a comfortable ride. It will take you right to downtown Playa del Carmen and a short $5 taxi ride (taxis right outside the terminal) can take you to Fisherman's if you must...

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Its Great!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff209
Reviews.Content: I took my family and a sister in law to the resort on June 28th and we stayed for a week. We had bought a week during the previous November and when I came home I read all the horror stories that have been spread by five or six people on several web sites. Despite pre trip misgivings, I am pleased to report that we had a great time! I feel sorry for the RCI exchangers. They have to buy the all inclusive plan. The resort is small and therefor has one restaurant and a limited menu. Knowing this, the resort gives its members a choice of buying the all inclusive plan on a weekly, or daily basis, or we even have the option of not purchasing it at all. (PERK!) We Sunset members get the chance to utilize the awesome variety of qualities, prices and tastes of foods offered in nearby Playa Del Carmen. We thought of the resort as a home base and therefor we thoroughly enjoyed it. There is so much to do: Xcaret, Cozumel, Chichen Itza,Coba, Tulum, Xel Ha, Cancun, the cenotes, clubs, shopping, jungle tours, fishing, scuba diving, para sailing, sky diving, snorkeling... the activities go on and on! When we would come home in the evening, we had our beautiful, large, marle floored, well decorated, well air conditioned, 2 bedroom/3 bath suite, with indoor jacuzzi, and a stocked kitchen ( Thanks to our excursion to Walmart.). The beds prepped. The maids do an excellent job. After a nice shower, using those big fresh towels and slipping into the provided robes, we grabbed cold drinks and went out on one of the three balconies to gaze at the evening sky. The rooms are big and well decorated. The employees are wonderful. The location is outstanding, (How often can you have Mayan ruins right across the street from your suite?) The ocean and hotel views are beautiful. The drinks were as good as you can get. After the trip I was not only relieved at what we had bought the timeshare, but felt the pride of ownership. My kids had a grand time. We shall go again and once more it will be our home base. For us, the all inclusive mega resorts seem like al inclusive traps. Thank God for our little Sunset Fishermen's Spa and Resort. Home sweet home for a week a year!

Reviews.Title: “Sunset people - not so bad..”
Reviews.Author: mko123
Reviews.Content: I just felt wanted to say that not all the reviews regarding the timeshares online is accurate. I had purchased a timeshare at Sunset, but decided to cancel largely b/c of the enormous amount of bad press that Sunset has online. I was expecting a grueling 6 mos battle to get my money back. Surprisingly, Sunset agreed to refund my money within a week of my notice, and 2 weeks later the correct amount was credited back into my credit card. The people I spoke to were generally pleasant.. I didn't get any threatening emails or letters from them. Makes me think that maybe all these online comments were from a couple of dissatisfied people. Good luck to anyone going through it.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: casjeka
Reviews.Content: In the overall the hotel was nice, clean, with good service & located in a convenient place (not too far from dowtown). The food compared to the big resorts was better because this is a small(ish) one so the attention is more personalized. Staff is most of the time friendly. However I had two bad experiences. The first one is that in order to get out of the hotel you need a car or if you like to walk in the heat for 10-20 minutes, that's the other way to get to town. To get a taxi is normally easy but sometimes you have to be persistent with the staff because they can forget you. I was in Playa to get married and on my wedding day, I asked for a van for a certain time and they forgot about it. Until they saw me in my wedding gown waiting at the lobby running late, they started to do something. The second thing, (and probably this happens at all the resorts, so be careful!) is that they are very keen to get you buy a timeshare. If you don't mind spending some time with people selling something, this situation won't affect you. Remember to keep your hand band/bracelet all the time. We took our bands off for the wedding and next morning we couldn't eat anything because of the band, even though we had paid for the week. Kind of surprising considering they knew we had just got married. Anyway, it's a good resort so even though I had some bad experiences I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Scam Artists! Don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: livinonvacay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel frequently to Mexico and the Caribbean and have never dealt with such unprofessional staff as we unfortunately found at Sunset Fishermen. We were scammed out of $450 dollars for a fishing excursion booked through the resort, with no ability for recorse. Salesman Said Silva took no responsibility and refused to refund our money. These people are scam artists and will tell you anything and everything to get your money. Lesson learned. It's quite unfortunate because Playa del Carmen is a fabulous town and we have had great trips there in the past to larger, more reputable resorts (The Royal for example). Go to Playa but do not give these crooks your money!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the Sunset Fishermen”
Reviews.Author: Roandro80
Reviews.Content: Obviously, we were a little uncertain about our visit to this resort based on previous reviews. We were (4 adults) very pleased with our stay. Marciel welcomed us when we arrived and took care of all our luggage. The check-in was easy. We paid our all-inclusive fees at the front desk and given wristbands. We were escorted to the oceanside restaurant and were invited to a lovely snack. We then sat with our concierge, Ingrid, who told us about the facility and of course, invited us to the timeshare. We said no. We were then taken to our room. There was a small, but comfortable living room area with a dining room table and a kitchen bar. This area had a patio facing the ocean with two chairs and a table. There was no dishwasher, however, there was no need since the maid washed the dishes each day. We noticed that there was no coffee maker and advised the front desk and it was deliverd by the time we returned to the room. There was a half bath in this area, as well. One bedroom was located on this floor with a full bathroom (large tiled shower). The other bedroom was on the 2nd floor and was quite large with another balcony. The food was good, not excellent, and the women did get somewhat tired of it; however, you would anywhere you went. The men in our group had no complaints and were happy. The beach was lovely and there was plenty of room to swim away from the sandbags. We felt there was no reason to walk to the beachclub. Pablo was a delight at the lobby bar. He was always smiling and happy to make anything. He filled our containers every day before we left on our adventures. One person won a mexican blanket during the welcome party and another won a massage playing bingo in our group of 4. There were activities if you wanted them. We did get invited to the timeshare presentation several more times during the week but always said no. My husband wants you to know that he scuba dived with Diversity Diving 5 days while we were there. He highly recommends Carlos and his crew. We also went to the bay to swim with turtles and used a guide. The view from our room was great and it was directly above the lobby on the third floor. We were able to get wifi in our room without having to go to the lobby to use it. The lobby was usually filled with people doing the same, so this was a big plus to having room #344. We were very impressed with how hard working the staff was and how they truly wanted us to enjoy our stay. They all tried to speak with us even with the language barrier. Would we go again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Sunset Fisherman disappointment”
Reviews.Author: DallasGogirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the beginning of June, 2008. After reading about it online and seeing really nice pics of beautifully redone rooms we had pretty high hopes of a nice vacation. We were supposed to have a 2 bedroom/ 2 bath condo.I was travelling w/ my 16 yr old son and 14 year-old daughter. Upon arrival we were shown to a very old, outdated, cramped condo w/ no view. In all the websites I had seen on the internet none looked like this. We asked if there was any way we could get one of the redone rooms and they told us all of those are studio 1 bedrooms. We ended up in an old condo that did have a nice view.Then since we traded in w/ a timeshare co. we were forced to buy the "all-inclusive" everyday. This is really not an all-inclusive. They charge $12.00 extra if you want lobster for dinner. It includes the breakfast buffet everday which mainly consists of bread, bread and more bread. Then you can choose to use coupons they give you for lunch or dinner in the 1 restaurant they have that has a menu that never changes. Food is very mediocre for the price of $61.00 a day per person! We had alot of coupons left over because my two teens hated the food. We had to go into Playa Del Carmen for them to find food they liked. ($5 by cab each way). Don't buy the so called "all-inclusive" if you don't have to.The other thing you should know is the pics on the internet of the nice wide beach? Forget it. After the last hurricane their beach is only a few yards wide and has slippery ugly sandbags everywhere and workers trying to build up the beach. This is not their fault, but if you enjoy walking up and down a beautiful beach on your vacation go to Cancun.The pool is tiny by Mexico resort standards. No activities. The pool is only 5 ft deep. The hot tub that is supposed to be adult only was filled w/ small children splashing you w/ their flippers. Not really relaxing.My two teens were very bored and sometimes would not even come downstairs because of the beach situation and tiny pool.If you have teens save your sanity and money and go to a large fun resort like Occidental or Iberostar. Bright spots? The employees (waiters/bartenders/maids) were all very nice and try to do the best they can with what they have to work with. The spa is very nice with a great work out room and they give a really good massage. One last note - beware of the timeshare people. They have complaints from people being swindled all over the internet. Just say no and go about your day. Don't be swayed by the "deals" they try to give you. They want your money and are very pushy. Say no! If you want to do a day trip, we went to Xcaret one day and it was worth every penny! Great scenery, food, entertainment!

Reviews.Title: “Sand, Sun, and Tranquility - The Yucatan's Best”
Reviews.Author: MPKustom
Reviews.Content: I will be taking some time to review Playa Del Carmen's Sunset Fishermen's Village resort & spa. I will discuss the following with some conversational style to give the review a personal, honest opinion of the resort, unbiased by all means possible. First, allow me introduce myself. I am a Citadel Cadet and I am 20 years old. I have been travelling to Playa Del Carmen to stay at Sunset Fishermen's Village with my family for our annual Christmas vacation. This vacation is the one necessity that I refuse to take out of my life and every year, this vacation is my chance to settle into one of the most relaxing, tranquil environments of the Yucatan Peninsula. I am thankful to admit that Sunset Fishermen's Village is the right place to travel in pursuit of the utmost serenity, selfless servitude from the faculty, and footsteps away from the adventurous nightlife on "5th Avenue." I have two brothers; each separated by 2 years apart, and my mother and father with the delightful addition of my grandmother partake in this journey together. We all agree that Sunset Fishermen is the best choice for a great escape from the stressors of the life back at home and the place to have null responsibilities at least for a one week. As such upon arrival, our luggage is carried in for us while we are casually greeted to a welcome response with cocktails, food, and immediate attention to hurry the start of a wonderful vacation. Some small talk with the concierge, frond desk, and we are off to our rooms where each room is equipped with ocean front bay windows, full kitchen, and outside Jacuzzi baths. There are delicate carvings in the walls to include the master bedrooms which aid to comfort the slight constant moving of the ocean to serenade each night to sleep. Out of the room, is the centerpiece of the resort property; the pool, surrounded by 2 different bar and restaurant areas, and a panoramic view of the beach. During my attendance at the Citadel, I have a close affiliation with the beach and the water as much of the physical training is done in the harbor and some at the beach to simulate the intense flavor of Basic Underwater Demolition drills with weights and team work. Also, I am a certified diver trained and assessed off the South Carolina coast line where visibility is limited to about a 10 ft. radius from the naked eye while diving in the “pluff-mud” infused water. It is, therefore, increasingly pleasurable to explore the depths of the crystal clear ocean water, extraordinary colorful reef environments, and the incessant underwater ecosystem that’s niche is on top of the purest white tropical sand. If there is one piece of advice I could give towards finding activity during the day, consider taking a snorkel/dive excursion. You will be very happy you did. As you lay under the sun, intermittently cooling off in the pool or the ocean, the selfless service of the faculty will kindly provide beverages and towels upon request. You are prompted to buy the "all-inclusive" package during the small talk when you arrive which provides you with an all day “open bar” life style, and 2 meals a day at whatever time you'd like to eat. Some have reviewed that it would be nice to change or alter the circumstances of the all-inclusive, but in my honest opinion, the Sunset group have done the work for you, and provided you with the motivation to go into town and eat from the finest local recipe's amid the authentic culture of Playa. My recommendation to encourage one place that is the most phenomenal restaurant experience, in my opinion, you should tell the taxi-cab to drive to "Alux" ("All - looj") or the "cave bar." This place is a fantastic bar and restaurant which takes place in the one of the most interesting wonders of the world...a cave! Eating underground in a cave, while the food has mixed reviews (I was impressed with the food), the atmosphere alone will solidly leave you with one of the best restaurant experiences one has never thought of. As for a 20 year old, wondering around downtown Playa on 5th avenue, I found myself to be comfortable anywhere I went. However, it takes a little bit of confidence to have a good time in the clubs, because meeting people isn't so easy; hence the idea that I only speak English and no Spanish whatsoever. For the most part, the locals behind the bar can generally understand English while the “morena” sitting with the cranberry vodka doesn’t. But this is what makes it fun, trying to speak Spanish after good number of "sol" beers or enough rum and then learning how to salsa with the pros! Another plus towards the nightlife perspective in Playa, is the beach clubs. Many of the restaurants have taken advantage of the beach setting and so do the clubs...it makes it interesting trying to dance in the sand, it gets tiring a little faster than normal. Further into the stay at Sunset Fishermen's village, there is one, and merely one, set back that will interrupt your total relaxations; the timeshare meetings and the persistent persuasion to upgrade. Please, when pre-briefing may sound nice as they will tell you it only takes "90 minutes of your time," try more like 4 hours! If you wish to see the future plans for the expansion of Sunset Properties and the newly comprise of "Tres Rios," you can easily observe the macro glass displays and the pictures on your own time without the annoyance to upgrade and spend more money. Sometimes it works to politely say "no thank you" to the meeting request, and other times it doesn't because they are very persistent and have even offered bribes towards attending the meeting. Each year, I am caught in this meeting, killing my unremitting buzz and wondering what my opportunity costs were for the time I could have been laying in the sun. So, do yourself a favor and try to "opt out" of the meeting. In conclusion, I would rank Sunset Fishermen's Village as the Yucatan's best get-away vacation for anyone looking for a peaceful atmosphere of no responsibilities and less obliged to lift a finger for self servitude. My family, prior to staying at Sunset Fishermen's Village, would stay at Sunset Lagoon, in Cancun. Unfortunately, I cannot admit that one will ever receive a serene moment in Cancun; In my opinion, Cancun is a non-stop traffic jammed party. Sunset Fishermen's Village has accomplished to reverse that non-stop party feeling you might get while playing downtown by giving the vacation-goers a tranquil place to rest your head. From the gratitude of the selfless service from the staff, daily clean and sanitary rooms, the composure and location of the resort from the beach or downtown, Playa Del Carmen's Sunset Fishermen's Village is the perfect get-away vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: ineedavacationbad
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through an RCI exchange. We got the 2-bedroom suite with 2 balconies and ocean views. The room was fantastic. We traveled with our 18-month old son, so it was nice to have an extra bedroom for him. The resort was great. It was a small, intimate resort and you didn't have to go far for anything (e.g., pool, beach, spa, restaurants), which was nice because we were forever forgetting something up in our room and had to run up several times a day. The pools were small, but nice. Our son pretty much got the kiddie pool to himself since there were no other children there during our stay. He absolutely loved it! The only drawback to this resort was the mealplan. With the RCI exchange, we were required to do the mealplan. It was expensive ($61/person/day) for breakfast and your choice of lunch or dinner. The food was not good, not terrible, but not good. For that amount of money, we would rather go out for our meals and would have gotten much better food. There also wasn't much variety when it came to food options. The breakfast they served was the same buffet spread everyday, which got tiring. We ate at the Italian restaurant one night, and that was pretty bad too. I'm not sure what the normal rates are at the hotel, but if you just book directly with them, you don't have to participate in the mealplan. Overall, this was a nice resort and we would definitely recommend it. If we do go back, we would opt out of the meal plan if possible. The resort is located about 5-minutes by car from the main 5th avenue strip of Playa del Carmen. We went there everyday either for lunch or dinner. There are a lot of shops and restaurants and just a nice place to walk around since there is no car traffic along the 20-block stretch. Tulum, a small beach town about an hour south of Playa del Carmen was worth the trip. White sandy beaches and you can rent lounge chairs by the beach and have food and drinks served. I would definitely recommend renting a car, especially if traveling with children, to get around whenever you wanted. There's also a Wal-Mart about 8 minutes away, so we went there a couple of times just to get some things we forgot to pack. That was really convenient.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, yet confusing”
Reviews.Author: lyndzer
Reviews.Content: it is a beautiful resort, my family loved the quaintness of it and the convenience to town. My issue was how confusing everything was with the meal plan, the staff wanted to sell you the "all-inclusive" packages and were very vague about how much menu items were if you didn't go for the "all-inclusive" package. It seemed as if they kept an eye on you as to whether or not you were getting the "package" for that day or not. I can't complain about the food, it was really good and we did choose to do the "all-inclusive" food and drink package 2 of the 4 days we were there. One other thing that we all noticed were all the tours that were going on around us as the staff really tries to put the sell on you to buy a time share. they immediately came up to us when we arrived and wanted to talk to us about a time share, but we quickly told them we weren't interested. because we didn't care to have a tour the once EXTREMELY friendly staff, then wanted nothing to do with us. We'd go back ONLY if the staff were more friendly (even if not interested in a time share) and eating and drinking became easier. (if you choose not to do a meal plan on any given day).

Reviews.Title: “I Love Sunset Fishermans”
Reviews.Author: Tahwee
Reviews.Content: Fishermans is the best. Beautiful rooms. Wonderful Shopping. Awesome Beach. Awesome People. Alberto, Luis, Isreal You Guys are WONDERFUL. I wish i never had to leave. The service was out of this world. I had the greatest time Laurie Reyes [--] Laurie.Reyes@genesishcc.com

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: IAmScubaMan
Reviews.Content: We have owned a studio unit at this resort since December 2004 and this was the first time we stayed there. We were very pleasantly surprised at how nice it is. We had a studio unit on the first floor that was steps away from the beach- Room 116B. The jacuzzi on the patio was a nice touch that we really enjoyed. The staff are all quite friendly. Yes, it is a timeshare property and they do try and get you to buy or upgrade your membership. You don't have to buy and we did the sale presentation in exchange for 2 hour long massages at the spa. They do offer a free shuttle into town twice daily at 9:30 and 11:00 am. Not sure how someone can complain about a free service, but someone sure did in another review. We never had to wait more than 5 minutes when we asked the from desk for a cab. I walked into town 4 mornings with my dive equipment and it took me less than 20 minutes. I used Scuba Libre www.subalibre.com.mx, a very nice outfitter who had 3 days of diving (2 tanks per day) for the reefs off PDC for $170. We only ate at the resort twice, once when we checked in and they had a buffet of appetizers and drinks (free of charge). The second time was on the Sunday night "Welcome party", again a buffet of appetizers and drinks, with a Mariachi band for entertainment. These dinners were offered at no additional charge. They do offer a meal plan for $55 per day (the dinner buffet by itself is $38.50 per person.) that includes breakfast and lunch or dinner along with unlimited drinks during the day. A good deal if you don't want to go into town for your food or take a taxi to Wal-Mart or another store for your beer. Sol beer was less than $11 per 12 pack and Bacardi Coco was $10 per liter at Wal-Mart. In addition to diving, we also went on the Fury Catamaran in Cozumel www.furycozumel.com (We join them on each of our trips to the PDC area). We also went to Xcaret and had a great time there looking at all the animals. The Turltles and Dolphins were our favorites. Great dinners were had at CH Super Carnes (Calle 1 Sur between 20th and 25th) , HC De Monterrey (Avenida Constityenetes between 25th and 30th), Babes Noodle House, and at La Parilla on 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Revised Review for Fishermen's”
Reviews.Author: Postie307
Reviews.Content: I had written a review about our stay at Fishermen's Village in Playa del Carmen. Apparently because of my review, the condo we stayed in has ungone some drastic changes and everything has been fixed. I was assured that all my concerns were taken seriously and they worked very hard to resolve everything. So rest assured, that you will enjoy your stay in this condo from now on. In addition, the pool area and the ocean are a lot of fun. There are activities and the staff were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to Stay in Playa”
Reviews.Author: SenorKroll
Reviews.Content: Sunset Fisherman may very well be the nicest place we've ever visited. They have found a way to provide all of the things necessary to compel you to return. From the minute you arrive, it's apparent that this is not your average place to stay. Marcial, the greeter, helps you out of the shuttle and completely tends to your bags. You will quickly come to appreciate his finely-honed customer skills. When you enter the open-air lobby, you are immediatly struck by the beauty of the architecture, the furnishings, and the striking view of the blue ocean. The entire staff provides a level of service rarely found. If you enjoy being treated like royalty, Sunset is a must do! The rooms are spacious, well-appointed, and comfortable. We stayed in a third floor two-bedroom unit that included a full kitchen, dining room, living room, and hot tub. An upper and lower balcony provided picturesque views from morning until night. Daily room service is provided in a truly professional manner. We participated in the all-inclusive and were very pleased. The buffet, breakfast, lunch, or dinner, provides a menu that will appeal to any taste with food cooked and presented better than in most upscale restaurants. The Italian restaurant on the lower level provides a breathtaking view as you sit a few feet from the surf, especially dramatic as the sun sets and the moon rises in the evening sky. If you're lucky enough to get Pedro as your waiter, get ready to experience the highest-possible levels of service. Make sure to spend some time in town (Playa del Carmen).
