The various merchants provide all types of merchandise and souvernirs,. If you run into a small shop owner named Fabian, be sure to check out his silver Mayan jewerly designed by his mother. And don't miss a meal at Ajua Maya"s (Calle 4 just off of La Quinta) for great food and the BEST margaruita's. I'm sure that you will fondly remember every moment you spend at Sunset Fisherman's.

Reviews.Title: “What a great time!”
Reviews.Author: AmPacked
Reviews.Content: I'd been down to Sunset Fishermen on two earlier occasions...for lunch and dinner, but never to stay. Another couple and we booked a 2-bedroom suite through RCI and we gave it thumbs up with just a couple of minor exceptions which I'll share in a minute. First of all, the weather happened to be absoLUTEly perfect, with no sweaters needed at night, but no one panting for AC either. For the entire week, we ate every single meal outside. What a treat. Our 3rd floor suite was perfect for two couples...both bedrooms were upstairs (4th floor!), private and well-appointed with their own balconies. The livingroom, full kitchen and 3rd full bath were downstairs, also with a full balcony. The only noticeably well-worn furnishing was the sleep/sofa there. The entire staff could not have been friendlier, more welcoming...from the front desk to the maids, they were cheerful and helpful and the waitstaff's #1 goal was to be sure you had everything you needed. "No worry; enjoy your vacation." The only drawbacks were: Upon checking in, we had a long wait while we were passed from one rep to another, almost like they didn't know what to do with us...but minimal timeshare pitch that night and NONE at all the rest of the week...not from anyone!! So that's minor, indeed! The food was great for breakfast and their snackbar lunches were really good. The dinners at the buffet were tasty, but after 3-4 days, were becoming a bit boring. The Italian restaurant (which required reservations) was very limited in its entree offerings and TOTALLY inconsistent. We ate there twice...once was really good; two nights later, not at all good. Hmm... The $30 USD for use in the spa was good toward a $45+ treatment. The manicure I had was by the cutest, sweetest girl whom I tipped $4 because of her demeanor, but my manicure looked like it'd been done by an 8 year old with a paint-by-numbers set...not even 'inside the lines'!! Luckily I was going home the next day and only had to sit on my hands for one evening! The beach has some erosion problems, with 2-3 large sand bags (don't step on them; they're slippery!!) but for exercise we were able to walk 400 yds down toward the Fishermen's 'other' beach club...and then walk another 100-200 yds on the street to arrive there where they had a mini-bar, beach chairs & bathrooms. I hear next year they're building an add'l restaurant there. There were always ample chairs around the pool, and down between the pool and the beach, as well as on the beach. A great location to 1)be lazy 2)walk into town-15 min 3) go for bike rides or 3) take day trips. Will we go back? Absolutely. We'll probably even do the Meal Plan again and just spring for a couple of meals on 5th Avenue to relieve the boredom. Hope this has been helpful. NB

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation”
Reviews.Author: mac928
Reviews.Content: See Nate and Bobbie's (from Iowa) review....they said it all. The resort is a dream come true. We were also there on our honeymoon and it was amazing. The service, the staff, the atmosphere, the location, the rooms are superb. We stayed in a studio sized room and it still had the full kitchen and a jacuzzi on the balconi. Sitting in bed we could see the beach and ocean! It was very comfy. The italian restaurant was very good, romantic and the service was excellent. Tipping does help, we are always good tippers but we did tip a bit more than usual and they deserved it. I don't know what else to say...Nate and Bobbie pretty much wrote a perfect review. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at the Fisherman”
Reviews.Author: nitramenat
Reviews.Content: If the bartender is asking you what you'd like to drink while you're in line to check in, and you've only been in line for 30 seconds, chances are you're in the right place. My wife and I had our honeymoon at the Sunset Fisherman, and for two people who had spent the better part of the previous year planning and organizing and generally doing stuff, this was a great place to not do anything for a week. We did the all-inclusive thing, which included breakfast and lunch OR dinner. 2 meals a day is what we're used to anyway, so that was fine, but we did get some lunch a couple days at the lower restaurant, the food was above average each time, especially the guacamole. prices for food not included in the meal package were very fair, we put two lunches for the two of us and 20 minutes of internet on our room charge, and the total at checkout was less than $40 usd. There is an Italian restaurant for dinner that requires reservations, which can be your freebie if you have the meal plan, and the food and atmosphere was rediculously good. I would recommend the Italian dinner at least a couple times a week for a perfectly cooked steak, wonderful seafood, and flawless service. Besides the ala carte restaurant that was Italian for dinner (it was burgers, quesedillas, chips & salsa etc. for lunch), the terrace restaurant was pretty good. A buffet-style setup, this is where breakfast was served, also lunch and dinner. Breakfast was really good, an omlette bar, great breads, and lots of fruit even for the off-season. We heard from a lot of people staying there that the sunset fisherman had some of the best resort food around. This was our first resort, so we can't judge on that, but both my wife and I have spent enough time in the service industry to know good food and great service when we see it, and we saw it everyday. Tipping helps. Our room was superb. We had a 2-bedroom suite courtesy of her folks giving us their RCI points for a wedding gift, and it was sweet. It had a full kitchen, fully set dining area for 4 people, nice comfortable furniture, good lighting, and a tv if you want to waste your time that way. a balcony on the first and second floor, the bedroom being on the second. an excellent bed, huge and comfortable, with a jacuzzi out on the second-floor patio. a full, nice bathroom on both floors, stocked with shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and tons of towels. I have tons of pictures of the room and grounds, just email if you'd like me to send you some. We tipped our housekeeper the first night($15usd) and got nice turndown service after that. Please be generous with tipping, the employees really appreciate it and it makes your time there so much better when the staff likes you. we spent around $200usd in the week just on tips, and it was well worth it. Miguel, the bartender, remembered what we drank, and our service at the restaurants was consistent with what we'd expect anywhere else. If you want a big resort with tons of people around and lots to do, go somewhere else. If relaxing in the ocean/pool/30 foot hot tub sounds nice, stay here. You won't be disappointed, but if you are, it will be your own fault. When you go to the Sunset Fisherman, tell Miguel behind the bar that Nate and Bobbie from Iowa say "que tal".

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Water_Junkie
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to book two weeks at this paradise, it was our second visit to the area. This property is close enough to Playa to walk to the abundant restaurants, dive & other shops. The meal plan food was okay most days, make reservations at the restaurant for an occasional dinner, it's a little better than the buffet. Make sure to tip the bartenders, your drinks will improve each time you go for a refill! We thought the meal plan was a pretty good value even with eating several meals in town - Playa's just too much fun! We experienced no pressure from time share salespeople, but if you are not adept at saying "no thanks" on arrival I can see how one could burn vacation time on a sales presentation. However, if you are in the market to purchase a vacation ownership this site should be at the top of the list if you enjoy smaller resorts. Our entire family considers this trip to be the best ever taken, a big score with kids aged 18, 16, & 13. There are activities to please all, nice spa, and in general it's a comfortable place to forget the rest of the world. We all want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cea68
Reviews.Content: I am a timeshare owner at Sunset Fishermen and can't say I'm any worse for the wear (though it wasn't cheap). What you get is beautiful ocean, a great central-yet-secluded location, and very nice rooms (we stayed in a 2BR master suite, overlooking the ocean). Playa del Carmen is thus far my favorite vacation destination - the beaches are absolutely gorgeous, and the town of Playa is fun and close by. The location of this resort is a pleasant walk from town (I think it took us 15 minutes), and in an upscale gated community, surrounded mostly by private villas. Last time we were there was before Hurricane Wilma, but the photos I've seen posted online look like they've improved the beach to be even better than before the hurricane. The water is blue, clear and beautiful and the sand is white and lovely. I like the fact that the all-inclusive fees here are not ridiculous like most other all-inclusive resorts (and for owners they're optional). I actually also like the fact that the all-inclusive fees include only 2 meals per day (dinner plus breakfast or lunch) - at other resorts when we've done the all-inclusive option we always end up bored with the food (3 meals a day for 7 days at the same place!) and wanting to eat out in local restaurants for lunch or missing meals when we're out on excursions anyway. I understand they have re-done the pool since last we were there, but I loved the swim-up bar (I hear they still have this in the new post-Wilma pool). We also love exploring the area - Tulum is a must-see every time (bring a bathing suit so after you tour the ruins you can go swimming at one of the best beaches ever - how often can you swim in beautiful turquoise waters while looking at Mayan ruins on the cliff above you?). We've also been to see the ruins at Chichen Itza and Coba (both worth it). The resort food does get boring after about 3 days (but this has been my experience at every all-inclusive I've ever stayed at). All in all, I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Traveler100705
Reviews.Content: I stay at the fishermen resort from July8-14th. We booked it through RCI because of a time share my mother gave me. So we were required to do the meal plan. We checked in a day late and we not charged for that day on our meal plan. The meals I thought we good almost everyday. The breakfast had a wide variety of fresh fruits, bread, made your own omelets, pancakes, and more. But it was the same thing everyday. The buffet for dinner was different everynight, so we ate there everynight but one. It was good. I usually could find at least something I liked. But it was also fun to try some new types of food. We went to the a la carte one night and it was very good but it's the same food everynight and not very many choices. But i was glad we went one night because it was good food. The room was very big. I went with a total of 8 people, (4 couples). The description of the room we booked said two double beds in one of the rooms and it wasn't. The front desk fixed it though after talking with them for a while. And we ended up getting a single room for free so we all had somewhere to sleep! The lobby bar was awesome. The night bartender knew us after day one and made our drinks for us stronger if we wanted him to. He made suggestions on good drinks too! The drinks were not watered down at all. The bar closed 10:30 and we didn't like to go to bed that early so we would get extra drinks close to closing time and they never cared that we did that. The swim up bar was nice but service was a little slower there. The pool was great and the beach was nice. There are still sand bags there but there are places to swim in the ocean or you can go about two blocks down to their beach club. They have entertainment guys that did activities most days. The girls enjoyed the cooking classes, espeically since we got to eat the food afterwards. They played sports on the beach and even did salsa lessons. Not really any activities for kids but we didn't have any kids with us. In fact, there we very few kids in the whole resort. Overall we all had a great time. It was very very relaxing and a great week. We usually stayed at the hotel most of the time because we tried not to spend lots of money. Everything we had a problem with they fixed which wasn't much. The staff knew you after a day or two. The small resort made it quicker to get service or get around.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at Sunset Fishermen”
Reviews.Author: ADM12
Reviews.Content: There were some minor problems during my stay at Sunset Fishermen but overall my husband and I had a good time! We were there on our honeymoon! The room was very comfortable and spacious! The resort has good facilities! We had a 2 bedroom just for the 2 of us! Food was good, we ate at the main buffet restaurant most of the time! They had a good assortment for breakfast, loved the plantains! A mix of local and american style breakfast! Only pancakes though, no french toast or waffles! They served almost the same hting every day though! Most of our dinners were at the main restaurants! We tried the A la carte once for dinner, it was nice, but limited menu! They also had limited items for breakfast! I didnt like the drinks at all, they kept making me nauseous after just one so I couldnt even take another one... So i ended up drinking wine! One pair of pants went missing and they couldnt figure out where it went and didnt try too much to resolve it either. We tried the Spa for a massage but right after I left my legs started getting itchy and when i got back to the room there were some red bumps over my legs... I'm not sure if something bit me there or it was an allergic reaction but I took an antihistamine tablet which helped it overnight... Everything else was good! Playa has alot of nice bars to check out! If they tried to sort out my pants problem I would have rated it much higher, but I did enjoy myself since it was my honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: Krim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort 6/16-6/23 as a timeshare exchange through RCI. We booked our transfers through the option available on the resort's website which was much cheaper than any other I found. We arrived at 7pm and there wasn't anyone else going there so they put us in a private car. Would have been great except the driver only used the fan. It was so humid that the windows were fogging up. Even though he was a 'sunset' driver he didn't have a clue how to get to our hotel once in Playa. That was the only setback other than the timeshare sharks. We had a 2 bedroom unit for only 3 people. The unit was HUGE, probably 1600sf and very nice. We were on the ground floor and had a patio off the living room and one off the master bedroom (which had a jacuzzi on the patio). The patio doors were double wide so had a great view inside even of the ocean. The cleaning people were probably in our room each day for 1-2 hours as there was so much space to clean. We had 2 bathrooms in our part and our daughter had a bathroom in hers so 3 full baths. Also had a full kitchen with all the amenities and a dining room. Housekeepers came in at night and picked up as well as turning down our beds. There are only 65 units here but it's amazing how many staff members there are. They work so hard and were probably the nicest people out of anywhere we have ever stayed. Even the night security guard always spoke, had a big smile, and a wave for us. He came up to me on our last night and said such nice things to me and asked if we'd be back next year. We did leave a tip each day for the maid along with a little gift. We also left something for the waiters but I never saw anyone else do it. I sat and watched the gardener trimming the grass around the restaurant with hand clippers. He had a bucket he'd pick the grass up and put it in there so there were no remnants. He worked so hard and it was so hot. I went over and gave him $5 which was all I had on me at the time and he was so shocked. I figured that the gardeners probably never got anything since they aren't on the 'front line'. Everyone raved about the spa so we tried it out. I've had a lot of massages and wasn't real impressed with the one I had. Their prices are really high so get recommendations from other guests before you book. I was told there are a couple people that are very good there. The massage tables are set up on the covered patio of the spa. It was so relaxing hearing the ocean waves during the massage as you are really close to the water. This resort isn't for anyone looking for a lot of action. It is very low key and laid back. There is an entertainment staff but they don't have a lot of organized activities. If you're wanting a nice hotel right on the beach where you can relax and unwind then it's a great place. Being so small we got to know a lot of the other guests and recognized them off resort. Being an rci exchange you are required to take the meal plan. The buffet wasn't bad at all and usually there were some really good choices. You can also eat at the ala carte restaurant. This is a 5 course meal and takes a good two hours to sit through it all. It was good but we aren't the type to drag out dinner all evening. You do need to make reservations for this restaurant ahead of time. The houses in this gated community are really nice. No one gets in without going through the security gate which was great for keeping the peddlers off the beach. In fact, I never saw one the whole week. The taxi's have to stay at the entrance to the community so they call down for one when you need it, no hassles from the cabbies wanting to take you somewhere either. We had a wonderfully relaxing week. Only went in to town to catch the collectivos (this is such a cheap way to travel) when we went to Xel Ha (buy your tickets online ahead of time as it's much cheaper) and Akumal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: smartin2704
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sunset Fishermen and Spa Resort on April 21st to the 28th. Our stay was awesome! The resort is small compared to others (65 units), but is beautiful. It was clean and the service we received was the best! It's within walking distance to the town of Playa Del Carmen so you can avoid the cabs. Don't miss dinner at Carlos and Charlie's! Tell Manuel (our favorite) the bartender "hello"!

Reviews.Title: “Great to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: holster
Reviews.Content: Wow, I don't know where to start. We, myself, hubby, his mom, his sister and sister's husband, stayed the week of Mar 24-31 and had an amazing time!! Although we had not been there for a year and a half it was amazing that the staff who are still there remembered us!! For us the small intimate family atmosphere is why we love this resort. We had a studio but the week before we were in Cancun at the Lagoon and upgraded our ownership, as a result we got to upgrade our room ,someone did not show up, and we got a master suite for no extra charge, much better for the 5 of us to spread out in!! Javiar in the Italian restaraunt was amazing, ask him for his awesome Mayan coffee after dinner, its so good. The beach is better than befor Wilma I think, the only thing I miss about the after hurricane reno is the hammocks!! For a quiet, calm intimate vacation Fisheremen's can't be beat!! I will stress again however that if you want loud, busy and party time, this is not the place for you. It is so close to Fifth ave in Playa del Carmen that you can wonder in anytime for excitement!! The massages outside with the surf in the background are wonderful!! We will be booking for next year right away and are counting the days till our return!

Reviews.Title: “Another year back and loved it again”
Reviews.Author: KPH2007
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our annual Sunset Fishermen's vacation. My family of six (mom, dad, two twenty something year old daughters and their significant others) stayed from March 3rd - March 10th and loved it. My family owns a timeshare which we purchased three years. We look forward to our annual get together at this beautiful resort. We can not say enough amazing things about the staff and resort itself - Jose, Manuel, Luis to name just a few. We did the all inclusive and from a beverage perspective was well worth it. Tons of fun activities - Xel-ha, Xcaret, Tulum and other Mayan Ruins in the area, hour from Cancun, and short 15 minute walk to Playa Del Carmen. Playa Del Carmen has tons of great restaurants, shops and nightlife. We took the ADO (bus station located in Playa Del Carmen) to Cancun one day for the Jungle Tour. Our favorites are Xel-ha and Xcaret - SO much to do at both!! I definitely recommend this resort which has an intimate friendly atmosphere. By day two the staff will certainly know you by name, thus making you feel right at home. On Sunday night you are greeted with a welcome party with a mariachi band and appetizers. At times you may be asked to do a presentation, but keep in mind you can say NO if you aren't interested. If you decide to do a presentation you can get some great perks for you and your family. Such as spa certificate ($200 US) or free tour of choice. My recommedation, if you do the tour make sure you to agree upfront on how long the presentation will take and remember you can say NO at the end. Our room was two stories with 2 bedrooms and a pull out sofa. Slept 6 comfortably. The room had an incredible ocean view. The resort is truly lovely and we wouldn't trade it in for the world! Already looking forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare AND happy!”
Reviews.Author: to-live-in-Europe
Reviews.Content: March 3-10, 2007 from Camden, Maine. Bought a timeshare one year ago there. Stayed one week last Oct and last week. Loved it both times, although we did request that we not be pitched the upgrades every time we visit! Just say no and they'll get the point, unless you want to upgrade, which in some cases is not a bad idea! Will give it the acid test this coming Oct to see if we can use our VIP weeks there or not. Love the place itself, friendly stable employees that must be happy or they would not be working there year after year, beach protected by sand bags to help recover from last hurricane, adequate warm pool, hot tubs, massages--excellent, only 65 units and not swarming with kids, and a 10 minute lovely walk into Playa, plus bikes to ride in adjacent, very nice neighborhood. What more could you ask for? Oil on the bike chains and more TV stations, especially in French and German. Food good and water potable; we took all-inclusive last year and that was fine, but bought our own food and prepared it in our kitchenette this time--depends on your interest. Drinks are weak, so remember this on the all-inclusive or buy your own bottle and tip it! Beds very comfortable, towels thick. Would love a self-serve laundry on site. Weather perfect, always a little windy, one hellacious storm. Loved Chitzen Itza and Il Kill Cenote tours. XCaret shortened and took the soul out of the the evening show, but don't miss the park. Go and have fun in the sun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bdysrfr57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week All Inclusive. It is a very small resort with wonderful staff. The food was average. Never got sick and always had something tasty, but lots of repetition. Earlier reviews complained of the bar only being open certain hours. We did not encounter this. We are not big drinkers, but never had a problem getting what we wanted. The hotel is right on the beach and they had huge sandbags out to rebuild the beach from hurrican damage. There was good swimming and body surfing on the north end of the resort. The rooms all have a kitchentte and whirlpool on the balcony. Almost every room is oceanview. The rooms were clean, but occasionally we saw very tiny ants. The area of Playacar it is located in is beautiful and very peaceful. The hotel has private homes on either side. There are Mayan ruins right across the street and the whole neighborhood felt very safe. There are bikes to use at the resort and they own a very nice beach club a block or two away. (take aqua sox, there are rocks in the surf). The beach was very clean and no sea grass. The walk into Playa del Carmen took about 15 minutes and was safe and scenic. Negatives: there were not as many onsite activities as I have seen at other resorts, and the pool is quite small and shallow (but very beautiful). The maids do use a bug spray in the kitchenettes which we could smell sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Our Family of 29 Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: MPSavoie
Reviews.Content: Our extended Family (29 of us in all!) stayed at Fishermen's Resort from Dec. 26, 2006 to January 2, 2007 and had an absolutely incredible once-in-a-lifetime vacation experience!!! Every 5 years our Father takes my 4 brothers & sisters, our spouses, and all the grand-kids on a nice vacation, and this was the year for our big get-away. Since my wife and I had visited Fishermen's 3 years ago, and had a GREAT experience, we pushed hard for a return to Playa with the whole family. We knew about all the bad press surrounding the timeshare sales, but felt confident that if everyone would "just say no" to the promotions & give-aways, that they would all have a fantastic time. Ultimately, through searching the internet, my Father was able to book 6 condo units at Fishermen's for the prime week between Christmas & New Years, and give us all the trip of a lifetime. I cannot say enough about what an incredible week we all had!! With 29 family members to satisfy, in 6 different condo units, you would think that someone would have at least a small gripe .... I can honestly tell you that each and every one of us went away with rave reviews, and warm, cherished memories about our time spent at "Sunset Fishermen Spa & Resort". From the beautiful accommodations and meticulously maintained grounds, to the incredible food, and especially the warm welcome and family hospitality we received from each and every member of the staff, our stay could not have been more enjoyable. There was not one single thing that I can imagine that would make our week any better. The all-inclusive rates are more reasonable than any other resort in the Cancun / Riviera Maya area, and participation is optional!! The drinks were free-flowing, and delicious!! The resort shows absolutely no hint of damage from Hurricane Wilma (although we understand that they had to shut down for several months for repair!). The beach has large sand bag break-walls installed, and the beach has been almost completely restored. Absolutely every member of the staff greeted us with a smile and friendly greeting whenever we would pass (perhaps they all realize that they are living in paradise!!). I could go on and on ....... With all of these positive words, I have to mention the one person who stands out as the ray of sunshine that never failed to put a smile on our faces: Louis acts as the activities director, cheer-leader and all-around ball-of-energy, and truly fantastic guy. His personality, charisma, genuine love of people, and joy that he brings with his infectious personality, is an incredible asset to the resort. Whether he is playing games with toddlers in the kiddy pool, playing football on the beach with the pre-teens, or giving bartending lessons at the pool bar to the adults, this incredible guy has a gift for making everyone feel welcome, and part of his "family". We were able to celebrate a very memorable New Years Eve, with dining, music and dancing at poolside. Our new-found dear friend Louis gave a heartfelt New Year's dedication, and led a special release of balloons at midnight with everyone’s wishes for the new year, that left most of the attendees in tears. As he made his way table-to-table around the pool, greeting all the guests, and extending his personal wishes for the new year, you really felt that this small family-oriented resort had discovered the "key to happiness", and was doing their very best to pass it along to their guests. I can't thank the Louis, and the entire staff enough for making our week so awesome. Keep up the great work ... we WILL be back!!!!!!!! Thanks for everything, Mike Savoie (Mr. Miguelito)

Reviews.Title: “In LOVE... listen up people”
Reviews.Author: Teresalynn
Reviews.Content: My father and I have been going to the time share for a few years now. In March were going again. For you out there who didn’t enjoy your stay well your bloody crazy! Listen up to me you wont regret it. The service at the Fishermen’s is great everyone is nice always smiling. I’ve made so many friends down there; you have Luis the fun loving, guacamole making, volleyball playing, smiling all the time guy, Poloma who introduced us to the timeshare, Dallas who gave us a life time agreement to the resort, and I’m not naming specific names but there all great! The waiters, the cooks, the spa ladies, the hosts, the beach people...and when I walked in the resort ohhhh it takes your breath away. It’s truly beautiful. You don’t have to worry its private. Gated in you have to have a pass to get in and if your wanting to be a lil shop happy then its easy to get to town its a beautiful walk or take a taxi.. And if you feel like a night on the town then there are so many restaurants to choose from you won’t go hungry. Also in the resort you have your Mayan ruins right there its warm the beach is great even after the Wilma hit and they were reconstructing the pool area. Which seems to be turning out great( may I add) they still had beach front for you... and the sweets breath taking, the beds are comfortable, you have your stove, microwave, TV, lovely bathroom, dinning room (of course it depends what kind of suite your staying in), the gifts you get, the room maids, are so sweet, the people.. If you have kids it’s not a bad place. You have the mariachi band, the pool, the fun with the kayaks, buggy boards, the tanning and more! I’m in high school and my friends don’t really get it there like "why would you want to spend time with your family" well that’s the thing I tell them I’m so relaxed and my father. Really why be stressed. Why? No! How could we? Would we be anger were in heaven. Dad and I love it. I set my whole planning on that trip. So once a year we set the date and leave our cold miserable wintry home and head out to what I consider my second home. I start packing a month ahead. I make sure I get my work done, my shopping done, so that nothing is stopping me from getting off that plane, over to the marina, to the hotel and into the room and there at that moment I just melt. ALL my worries float away into the warm breezing Mexican air and I’m truly in paradise. I love you all at the Fishermen’s Sunset Resort/Timeshare and I have bragged about you to everyone who is looking for a relaxing wonderful vacation...can’t wait for March to come Sincerely your guests

Reviews.Title: “RUN AWAY!!! Don't Walk !”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotiaCat
Reviews.Content: I too was terribly ripped off by Neil Cooper, the sale's manager at Sunset Fishermen's. I too was "guaranteed" $1700 USD /week if I wanted to rent out my suite. He threw in special deals and lots of promises and I read everything carefully BUT when the paper work finally came through it turns out that the promises he made were left out. After having been plied with drinks and , yes, champagne, I did my best but as a single mum (with my 2 kids in tow) I wasn't at my best for making such a major decision. After fighting with Sunset and Mastercard for a year, I finally went through the numbers with my accountant who advised me to RUN AWAY!! He said I should consider it a sad $20,000+ loss but to forget it and move on. I feel physically ill when I think of the money I lost. Money I could not afford to lose! But I try to keep it in perspective: My kids are great, no-one died etc etc. PLEASE LEARN FROM ME!!! visit the "squeaky wheel" for countless more identical stories!!! Catherine

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: johnstoj
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 12 day trip to PDC and Cozumel. Our week at Sunset Fishermens was great. We avoided the timeshare presentation despite many incentives that were offered. A day at the spa, tickets to XelHa ... Once they realized that we were not going to fall for the bribes, we were left alone. The staff is all very helpful and gracious, the location is ideal for quick strolls in to PDC for a good cup of coffee, the food on-site is OK (not cosmic but passable), the sand is fine but you can't easily get into the ocean because there are big sandbags in the way. They seem to be trying to keep the sand in place but it looks like a make work project as far as we can tell. A big machine spent a couple of days relocating sand out to the sandbags only to have the ocean relocate it into the ocean overnight. All in all, we found the resort to be a fine place to stay but wouldn't have been at all happy if PDC wasn't so close so we could jump on a bus to do some exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare Scam - Stay Far Far Away!”
Reviews.Author: blue_catzz
Reviews.Content: At the Cancun airport near the baggage claim area, stand people dressed in uniforms who falsely misrepresent themselves as government officials. One of those people offered his assistance in providing traveling tips for Cancun. This person told us that they worked for local Mexican-owned resorts in Cancun to promote their businesses to American travelers. We were offered a no-obligation tour with a resort called Fishermen’s Village, which operates under a business entity called the Sunset Group. They asked us to take a van ride to the hotel, eat breakfast, and take a look at their facility. In return, we were offered a free day-trip ticket to Chichen Itza, or other destination. We paid a $40 USD as refundable deposit to ensure we would show up. The tour assistant insisted we bring at least one major credit card, as those major credit companies are the "sponsors" of their promotion. We subsequently discovered that those companies are not related to the Sunset Group’s promotion. At the agreed time the next day, a van driver came to our hotel and took us to the Fishermen’s Village Resort. We were greeted by a hostess who asked us to show her our major credit cards. We were then introduced to a salesperson, Maureen Kimmel. Subsequently, Maureen told us this is a timeshare presentation, which we were not aware of until then. She asked if we own any timeshare properties and we said no. Maureen called her manager and said he would "authorize" Maureen to proceed with the tour even though we don’t own timeshare property. We wouldn’t have wanted to get involved if we knew that this was a timeshare presentation before this time. Maureen showed us rooms on the top floor with an ocean view. Obviously, being on the top floor and having an ocean view, the units were the best ones. Then, Maureen brought us to the sales office. The timeshare she offered us was very expensive, and we said no immediately. Then she called in her manager, Neil Cooper, and they brought out another offer called an “investment package.” They showed us how we could make a profit if we rented the property through their agent, Resorts International Marketing Corporation, with a one time processing fee of $549. We were promised that our timeshare would be rented out at $1,700 per week and would pay for itself within five years. Neil said it was a ''no lose investment.'' They also insisted that buying a membership in the Admiral Yacht Club would significantly increase our ability to rent our timeshare. We were not told that none of the amenities of the Admiral Yacht Club were in Playa del Carmen - they are all an hour away in Cancun. When we refused the timeshare, Neil offered to remove three VIP weeks from the first four years of the contract to lower the price. He also continued to promise rental income so we could afford to take our four children on vacation. After being placed under such duress, we finally agreed to sign the contract. When we agreed to sign the contract, Maureen and Neil opened a bottle of champagne and offered us glasses of it. Thus, we were under the influence of alcohol at the time we reviewed the contracts and signed them. When we reviewed the contracts, they sped through the paperwork saying “you don’t have to even read this now.” We were never notified of our five-day right to cancel the contracts. Upon returning home, we reviewed the contracts carefully and realized that many promised items were missing, including the promised rental income. At the time we signed the contracts, Maureen and Neil promised us that the timeshare would increase in value and could easily be rented or sold. After doing Internet research, we discovered that Sunset Group timeshares cannot be sold at any price. Nor can they be rented, even when offered at the standard maintenance fee. (See eBay.com and Google.com). They also told us we were investing in fixed price travel. However, the Sunset Group can and does raise its maintenance fee 6% or more each year. In June 2006, we sent Sunset Group a letter terminating the contracts. Now, they have sent our account to a collection agency, Resort Management International (RMI). RMI has called my parents and us repeatedly, yelling at us and threatening us if we do not pay for the rest of the contract. They have also sent us three notification letters trying to collect.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time at the Fisherman-Loved it-Feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaNicole
Reviews.Content: I just got back a week ago. The staff is great, Fernando the head of the kitchen staff, Manuel, Lenny, all of them so friendly and made me feel right at home. I was there for 10 days. They have replaced the children's pool with a huge hot tub that does not get really hot but is warmer than the pool. They have a welcome party and a good bye party every week. I love this small personable resort. All the complaints I hear are about the timeshare presentations: My advice.....just say no. Don't go. Buy it on the secondary market on Ebay where I sell timeshares for prices you would not believe. I traded into the Fisherman two years in a row now. Like I said just say no. Enjoy your stay, see the area, don't waste your time at timeshare presentations. See Tulum, Xel Ha, Cozumel. We snorkeled at Cozumel and Xel Ha and it was amazing. This resort has an Italian restaurant night you get for free if you are on the all inclusive plan. The presentation is wonderful, the ambiance right by the ocean is romantic, the service very good....have the Mayan coffee, a flaming drink made at your table. The spa is fabulous.....have a massage outside on the covered deck while the waves wash up on the beach. The sound of the waves and the massage by Vickie is to die for. This resort is close to Playa and we saw people walking to town but we had a car. 5th Avenue is where all the action is, cobblestone streets with people sitting out having dinner, drinks, music playing, the Blue Parrot has dancing on the beach, the Mambo Cafe has live Cuban music and another bar/hotel had a live band we visited three or four nights.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: sailfish3
Reviews.Content: Time share sale that bursts the boundaries of absurd. They do a two for one deal (in weeks) and it is 70 Grand (American) to play. Yikes and run for the hills. The annual service fees were incredible as well. Everything ala carte and additional. As we attempted escape (3 sales people later), we were quoted 3000 dollars. Apparently you get nothing for the 3K. And after talking to folks that had spend the 70K, they got nothing either.

Reviews.Title: “liars and thieves..”
Reviews.Author: grchy
Reviews.Content: Unless u spent lots of $$$$$ for certain weeks.. forget it.. u will never get that they offered... the food left overs. drinks bars closed until 5pm no chairs at the bar.. told by staff " the 2 bed rooms are for the clients who spent 30,000 Plus and so are the ocean rooms.. and u only spent 3,000. for weeks... foods went from only about 29.usd for non drinkers to 88 usd. and told " there is no different charge for non drinkers!" LIARS DO NOT PURCHASE.. And the food in playa holel is Horrid Unhappy and will NEVER go back...

Reviews.Title: “timeshares ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: thanks for the update! i was there in february this year and bought some timeshares of this spa and resort hotel ... it has been stressful enough till now ... for me at least ! the reason is everything is so remote and you never know how reliable or trustworthy this hotel group is. yes, they were not pushy in getting you into the 'pool'. plus, they did give you a 'vacation certificate' which is good for 6nights and 7days free accomodation right on the spot. you may use it for your next vacation. still, the risk is there ... as every issue they mentioned sounded soooooo promising! i have been sending emails asking about some issues that i concerned about. be honest, it took quite a while to have a reply from them, if there is any. from this update of the tourists of texas, thanks again! at least now i know or i believe they are some kind of good stuff ... and my savings are not going somewhere mysterious! hope things will go on fine!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation in years!”
Reviews.Author: hook_em_travelers
Reviews.Content: I am sorry that some people feel that they were "scammed", but you shouldn't buy into a timeshare unless you plan on using it for vacation. My husband and our young son spent a blissful week at the Sunset Fisherman's Spa and Resort. The staff was WONDERFUL! By the second day we were there, the bellman, activites director, waiters, and other hotel staff knew our entire family by name. They went above and beyond to meet our every need without us having to ask for a thing. The food at the restaurants are the best I have had at any hotel in the Mayan Riviera, and I have stayed in many over the past years. The person who wrote that you had to pay $79.99 per day for the all inclusive is NOT correct. We just got back today and I can tell you the we payed $42 per day for ALL drinks, breakfast everyday, and the choice of lunch or dinner daily. Children under 6 stay and eat free. Plus, the resort is OPTIONAL regarding the all inclusive. That's right, you don't have to participate in it if you wish to eat and drink elsewhere. Also, the beach is almost completely back to its original state as they are working very hard all day long to pump sand back on the beach after hurricane Wilma last October. They have free boogie-boards, ociean kayacks, life jackets, and floatation devices for the kids at the wonderful pool. You can also borry a book from their poolside library. Take a cooking class from Luis, as they are a lot of fun. The week we were there we made: seafood payaya, ceviche, and we had a mixed drink class as well. Take advantage of the bicycle tour of the gated community of Playacar (which is where the resort is located). Yes, you will go through the timeshare presentation, but they are NOT pushy! Say "No" politely, and they will leave you alone. We loved this place, and we will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “time share sales”
Reviews.Author: Janichic
Reviews.Content: We were approached at thrifty car rental in the airport to see a time share presentation at fisherman's village in Playa Del Carmen. We were stupid and went for the free gifts, knowing full well that we would be pressured. But hindsight is 20/20. The resort was gorgeous and 5 hours after the presentation started, after many refusals, we had signed a contract. My family already owns a timeshare and they can be wonderful ways to travel. But the people at fisherman told us bold lies - that we would make money off the properties, that we were getting 4 weeks instead of 1, that we had to waive our rights to cancel (illegal by mexican law), etc. Thanks to the internet and knowing about our rights, we were able to cancel but the staff there told us we could not and did not accept our written letters. They did accept the free gifts that we returned. We ended up having to copy our cancellationrequest to the Mexican consumer protection agency - PROFECO and cancel our credit cards. Luckily we did this all within the 5 day cancellation period. Sadly, several other visitors to fisherman's that same day also had bad experiences there! I wish I had read this website before I went to the sales presentation. I hope others can learn from our experience. Skip the free gifts and have a worry-free vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Scoundrels”
Reviews.Author: glasslipper
Reviews.Content: We agreed to hear a time share presentation and then regretted that we wasted so much of our day. We were polite, listened and considered what they were offering and recognized that it was not a good investment. When it came time to buy we said "no" at which point we were passed to 3 other sales people who tried to coerce us into a purchase. Four hours after the presentation began we were finally finished. We left with "certificate" good for 6 nights and 7 days. When we called to make the reservations, they had a little surprise for us. It would cost $79.99 per day per person for meals and it was not optional. In their presentation they stated meals are optional, or you can opt for only two meals so you can visit some of the resturants in the area or go on day trips. These people are a complete and total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “We love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: hlbrill
Reviews.Content: Spend our second week here Feb.25 to March 4.They did lose the pool during Wilma, but it's almost redone, and mostley by HAND! This is our second time here. We own 2 weeks at Sunset Lagoon. Both are excellant! They have a wonderful beach, park area just a short walk north. Hope to stay 2 weeks there next year! Service and staff are excellant. Our hats off to all the hard worked putting the entire area back together. Will post pictures soon.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort run by rip-off artists”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We bought at Sunset and have been there several times. The resorts are nice but the sales people are like pirhanas and the people in the office are either lazy or crooked. We paid for three weeks and they only acknowledge two weeks, even though we have the visa records to prove it. Our advice - go there if you get a good deal but avoid the sales people and don't buy.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the Scamming sales people”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four months have past and we are still waiting for our refund. We asked for a refund within 5 days as required by Mexican law after reconsidering our purchase. The sales people agreed ( no problem) that we could have a refund and told us that there was a "special" procedure to follow. They told us that we had to wait while they sent for the papers that were already sent to the States. A personal email was given ( sales manager) to us and what do you think happened? We went back to Canada and the emails were never answered and the refund has never happened. Beware of the Sunset Fisherman scam artists.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in Playa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been reading the horrible reviews on this resort, and have come to the conclusion that these travelers are either unfortunate, or very bad business minds. Went in 2003 for a timeshare presentation and ended up wiring $78,000 down to them for 8 weeks of timeshare. Arrived 1 year later for my annual winter vacation with my family of 6. My presidential suite was ready, and we got right in. The stay was very pleasant. Facilities are above average, and the property is absolutely fantastic. Beach had eroded a little since the year before, but Mexican erosion officials were in the process of pumping sand back to the beach. Room service was prompt on orders, drinks were fantastic. The on site restaurant/bar was also supurb. We were not billed anything extra(which some resorts are renown for) and were on our way home after a fantastic week. I will admit that the timeshare sales persons are persistant, and it is clear they are working for commission. However, I do believe their persistance is driven more by personal finances, rather than resort code of conduct. I will caution any future buyers however, that it is sometimes difficult to make Interclub reservations, being that you are dealing with persons in another country, and being that you have to contact the resort directly for reservation requests.

Reviews.Title: “timeshare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a scam they have going at fishermans resort,they tell you that you can get your money back within 15 busniess days guess what it is not going to happen,do not trust any sales people there, they are a total rip off.

Reviews.Title: “4 wonderful days then the hurricane hit....”
Reviews.Author: jubreu
Reviews.Content: We had 4 wonderful days!!! We sat through the "90 minute" time share pitch that turned into 4 hours of relentless pursuit of our $, but that was our fault for falling for the lure of the spa services in return of our time. We did not buy since we already have a time-share. The service was superb! Our room was very nice and the staff was awesome. Hurricane Wilma made her appearance and we were evacuated to a shelter in Cancun where the other 2 Sunset Group resorts were evacuated. There were a total of 640 resort customers staying the shelter. The staff accompanied us to the shelter and worked round the clock to meet our needs during and after the hurricane. I can not BRAG enough on the staff of the Sunset resorts!! They ensured our safety in every way possible. A few people were disgruntled because we rec'd 2 meals per day but we understood that supplies were hard to get in the hurricane and we were extremely thankful for the meals that we rec'd. We heard of other resorts and hotels that gave food to their customers and told them where the nearest shelter was so we were by far the most fortunate hurricane evacuees due to Sunset's efforts. Some resort customers were unhappy because Sunset did not make travel arrangements for them. Hello? Sunset resorts are not in the business of transportation, they are in the resort business and do it very well. Jose Luis was the cream of the crop. He ensured we received our luggage from the resort after the hurricane and ensured we received the communication and did everything possible to keep our questions answered. The staff will probably be laid off until the resorts are repaired and this makes us sad as these people are the hardest working and most pleasant people we have encountered the service industry. Sunset Fishermen Spa and Resort made a terrible situation as comfortable as humanly possible.

Reviews.Title: “we had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my dad has the time share at fisherman's village( playa del carmen). I was skeptical. But it was great, Jose luis I'm sure doesn't get paid enough for what he does. He remembered my dad from the year before. That makes all the difference in the world, when you feel that special. A warning to the people peaved about time shares. And I WAS ONE OF THEM. Your only mad at yourself for falling for the living beyond your means mantality. And then you wake up a couple of days later and panic. Don't panic ask for your money back if you don't get it. Call the PROFECO. Spelling might be off on that. Or tell them you are calling the PROFECO. They are like the better business bureau in mexico. They deal with the time shares all the time. But remember, if your living the perfect retirement life-style. Time shares are for you.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I ever stayed!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JHS999
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how bad this place was. The room was not facing the water at all...instead it overlooked a parking lot and smelly trash heap. Furthermore, the air conditioner didn't work. The flys were horrible! The service was awful. Totally non sympathetic staff not willing to help the situation at all. There answer was to go to the bar and get drunk! I will never stay at this place again! Also they were always out of beach towels to use!

Reviews.Title: “SCAM stay clear,”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As with many other people or couples who are talked into the 90 minute nightmare, thats exactly what this, our first trip turned into and it is not over yet. My wife and I where duped into this time share also, everything sounded to good to be true, and after sitting down and reviewing the contract it was to good to be true. After signing the contract on the third of sept, we read the contract and returned on the fifth of sept to cancel, the contract stated we had five buisness days to cancel so we returned to Playadel Carmen from Cozemal to cancel. Our salesman, who went by the name of Carlos who was a very charming and sweet talking Italian said there would be no problem with us canceling as long as we explained why. Our salesman then took our folder along with our contract and had us hand write on a sheet of paper the reason why we were canceling. I was concerned that I might not make it back from Iraq, and did not want to put that burden on my wife so we canceled. Carlos then talked to the manager got a signature and put the last four numbers of our contrat on the paper. He told us that was all we needed and told us to enjoy the rest of our vacation, that the charges would be taken off of our gredit card in thirty days. Needless to say I am back in Iraq, and some gentleman who only speaks spanish has emailed and phoned my wife threatning her with lawsuits if we did not pay. Since then my credit card company as of now is disputing this matter which is not yet resolved, and like other people who have been taken by this scam, we have no number to reach these people and they will not give us a copy of the contract. If anyone has a copy of this contract please email a copy to shoau2@aol.com so our credit card company can review it. Please anyone who goes on vacation to cancun cozemal or playa del carmen, be aware if it sounds to good to be true, it probably is.

Reviews.Title: “never again this is a scam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i went on my 1st honeymoon after 25 yrs.of being married with my husband.we were scammed into a a bad deal. our contract as a having a membership was canceled and they kept the contract and gave us soleley a hand written letter it was canceled.we had 5 working bessiness . days to decide if we wanted to keep it or not .well needless to say we canceled and now they won't give us our money back but our credit card is fighting this back.remember people nothing is for free this is just a way of reeling you in .be very very careful what you sign this people are not your friends they are out to get you.talk is cheap but it's free just say NO NO NO and that's final.our honeymoon turned out to be a nightmare don't be thier next victim they are heartless they don't care about you just remember they did it to us it's 7,000 dollars my husband has worked for over seas .PRAY FOR US THAT THIS DOES GET RESOLVED SOON .i hope justice is done and please be careful they are everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Mexican Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fisherman Resort and Spa in Playa del Carmen is the most unethical time share company that exists. They don't live up to the terms of their contract. A timesare was purchased and the contract stated that it could be cancelled within 5 days if so desired. This is not the case. We decided overnight that we didn't want the time share and immediately went to the resort the next day asking that our contract be cancelled. They took all of our paperwork. refused to issued a credit to our credit card and we've been hung with having to purchase a time share or pay a hudge cancellation charge. The sales people tell you that this can be cancelled, but they do not tell the truth. This company gives you nothing but a run around after your name is on the dotted line. I would suggest to anyone thinking of using this establishment (Fisherman's Village and/or Fishermans Resort and Spa) or buying a time share for these resorts to BUYER BEWARE!!! You're about to be taken!!!

Reviews.Title: “I got my money back !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sykobanker
Reviews.Content: For those of you in the same boat, I did get my money back!!! I filed a dispute with my credit card company, Citibank. It did take about 3 months, but it was resolved in my favor. I cannot stress enough......... DONT FALL FOR THIS SCAM!! IT IS TRULY A SCAM AND NEARLY IMPOSSIBLE TO RESOLVE.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK....”
Reviews.Author: kae106
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat hesitant after reading some of the reviews, but found that we had no trouble with timeshare sales people. We told them upfront at check-in that we weren't interested and we were left alone all week. The resort is small and there's really nothing to do there...no music, no activities, just the beach - which is down to almost nothing at the resort after the past few hurricanes. There's only room for one row of lounge chairs. You can't walk very far in one direction cause the beach is completely eroded, and the other direction you can't walk at all cause the water is right up to the sea wall. The resort has no shops or convenience store on site, so you must walk into Playa del Carmen (about 15-20 minutes). The resort is in the middle of a gated community with houses all around - not sure how the resort came to be located there. You really have to be into pure R&R to enjoy the resort cause there is nothing to do there. The food was just mediocre for the most part at the outdoor buffet (mandatory all-inclusive through RCI) area which was pretty boring. Italian at the other outdoor eating area was actually pretty good. I was surprised at the service throughout....very attentive and helpful. It would be a really great place if there was some kind of gift shop/convenience stor on site, and if management could arrange for more activities such as music during the day and some on-site activity at night so you're not reliant on walking into town when it's real hot and humid. An enclosed air-conditioned restaurant would be great, too.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love this place. and the staff, so much that I just can't seem to get tired of it. Maybe it's just me. I know, I know, I've seem the scathing reviews of the place, but I've been to this resort four years in a row now, and still would not even consider stayning anywhere else. Yes, the food is mediocre, but if I want good food, I can stay at home. Too many pretentious people, too much time on their hands. I just remember that an ounce of pretention is worth a pound of manure. (It's a Texas thing...) If you have NOT, give this sweet little resort a try. I've always been made to feel like a king, and yes, I deserve it...

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: luvcarrib
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why there are so many variations in reviews on Fishermen's. I am not a salesman or Dumb@$$ as mentioned in another review, but a 15+-year exchange user of RCI exchanges. We stayed at Fishermen's 2 years ago and was satisfied, and aware of the current reviews, went back with some lowered expectations. Due to no available flights on Sat 6/18, we knew we would check in on Sun 6/19. I phoned, speaking with Pablo, on Sat to tell them we would be in on Sunday to be sure we would have a room. When we arrived, Pablo checked us in and we had one of the beautiful new studios right on the end next to the beach, just as he had promised me on Saturday. I also expected to be required to pay 7 days of meals plan, but since we checked in on Sunday and planned to be out Friday, they only charged for 5 days. Monica went thru our welcome packet and asked if we had any questions about the resort. We did not. She mentioned they now have 2 sister resorts if we were interested in touring. The next day another lady asked us if Monica explained everything and we said she had. Nothing else was mentioned about a tour or sales pitch. I got a 60-minute massage, discounted $30 as part of the mandatory meal plan. The meal plan was better than two years ago, no reservations required and food was more varied. We usually ate lunch and breakfast and dinner in town. We did Xcarta one day, by taking the local bus (colectivo) for 65 cents per person and taxied back that night for about $12. We took the Greenline from the airport to Fishermen's for $38 for 2, but maybe could've gotten cheaper tickets outside the airport. Everything in our room functioned correctly. The air conditioning was more than cool. We turned it down. Sometimes the water wasn't as hot as my wife likes, but it was OK for me. Service was great. We always offered a buenos dias, como es't, por favor and gracious, sometimes I left a small tip. The drinks were plenty strong. Some people just walked up and said "beer", without any manners at all. Names I remember were Jose and Alex at the bar, Louis the activity director, but there were several others that were VERY attentive. The room was cleaned everyday. Towels and kleenex were folded into swans and flowers. This is a small, quiet resort. Not many planned activities. You can use the free kayaks to paddle a couple of resorts down and rent jet skis, parasail or sail boat. We also enjoy the 15-minute walk into town. The beach is smaller than two years ago, but adequate. There were always plenty of lounge chairs and we particularly liked the hammocks on the beach, also always available. While waiting in line at the airport to return home, another couple mentioned they had toured Fishermen's and received $200 cash, and only had about a 90-minute tour. They said some others took about 3 hours, but they were OK with Fishermen's. Feel free to contact me with any specific questions. ----

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation at (Sunset) Fishermens Village”
Reviews.Author: gskline
Reviews.Content: After reading many trip reports we were terrified what our vacation would be like at Fishermens. We had used a timeshare exchange through RCI, so we only have 3 choices of hotels for this area. The other two did not have more than 1 bedroom units, and my wife and I wanted privacy from our teenagers, so we went with FV. Let me set the record straight...we had a wonderful time there. Our vacation started out very badly. Our direct flight by US Airways was supposed to get us into Cancun at 11AM Saturday. Due to understaffing, we did not get into Cancun until 2AM Sunday!!! When we finally got to FV, at 3AM, we were warmly greeted. Our luggage was taken to our room and I was relieved to see we got the exact room we were promised. The rooms had two separate patios (they were 1st floor) and each had a jacuzzi tub on them. The view was breathtaking. We weren't more than 20 feet from the beach!!! The rooms were very nicely decorated. We had a minor problem with the A/C in the Master bedroom. They tried to fix it twice, wasn't perfect but was acceptable. Now to answer the dreaded TIMESHARE stories. The first day there we were politely asked to speak to one of their timeshare people. She started into her pitch and I told her we already owned one elsewhere. After 15 minutes and 3 no thank you's, on my part, we were released and NEVER bothered again. If you were brought there from another resort, I'm sure it would be much more difficult to get away from the sales pitch. Looking at previous pictures of the resort, it has lost a considerable part of it's beach. But since the resort only has around 90 units, there was plenty of beach to go around. We never had to get up early to reserve a chair. This was one great thing about FV, there were not wall to wall people like at the big resorts. As an RCI customer, we were required to do the AI. You got all the drinks you wanted (they were NOT watered down), breakfast, and either lunch or dinner. Breakfast buffet was very good. The lunch buffet got boring after a few days, seemed to be the same food all the time. I was advised to make reservations at their Italian sit down Rest. It was great! We ate there twice plus the service was really good. The other nights we walked into town to eat. This is another good thing about FV, it was only a 15 minute walk into Playa del Carmen. The walk was very romantic, through a residential area with flowering trees and Mayan ruins on one side, and the Carribean on the other. Very beautiful! Every night when we returned to FV, the Lobby Bartender Manuel warmly greeted us and prepared our favorite drinks. We did excursions, some on our own and some through AGI Tours. I won't go into detail here, but I would be glad to answer any questions for first timers or those that are interested. Julio (AGI Tours) took us on an all day trip to Chichen Itza. He was a wonderful personal tour guide. All in all I would recommend Fishermens as a good place to take your family. If you are looking for nightlife it is not at the hotel. Everything shuts down at 11PM, which we really appreciated! If you want to go wild, you are only a 15 minute walk into town, where all the bars are. Greg

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with this RCI Gold Crown Property”
Reviews.Author: divedive2
Reviews.Content: Our group of four (one adult male--two adult females and one male child--11) arrived by taxi from Cancun around 1:30 pm Sat,5/21 for 7-days.We were escorted to a second floor reception area for check-in-----the meal plan purchase and what would have been a timeshare presentation (had I let them).The staff was very polite and check-in went smoothly------ditto for the meal plan purchase------breakfast each morning and lunch or dinner.We were given 7 coupons each, to be used as we wished for lunch or dinner each day and and all house drinks were comp'ed.Food purchases from the pool bar were not included. You can eat in their sit-down Italian Restaurant each night and choose from a limited menu ( the food is excellent---my opinion. The buffet lunch and dinner are okay--filling and always lot's of fruit.My RCI swap was for a 2-bedroom - sleep 8 unit. I could not have asked for more---two story oceanfront with kitchenette, dining area, sitting area with sofa bed,bathroom and patio on first level of this third floor condo.The second floor housed a standard bedroom with two beds--a bathroom and patio with an ocean view----and the master bedroom with a king bed----jacuzzi (in the master bedroom)---- a full bathroom with a very wide patio overlooking the pool -- beach--and ocean WITH an additional jacuzzi on the patio.The grounds are immaculate-----the entire staff was warm -helpful and friendly.This resort is located within the gated cummunity of Playacar (with quarter million dollar and above homes)---a 5 to 10 minute walk to Playa Del Carmen. The beach is sort of small with easy access to the ocean----okay.I've stayed at many RCI Gold Crown Resorts around the Caribbean and have never been disappointed---and The Fisherman Resort & Spa is right up there with the best of them. They do bring lot's of people there for timeshare presentations which I did not find a bother to me.The sales people can be very agressive-- BUT a polite no thanks--I'm not interested will take care of that and takes care of additional solicitations. An above avreage resort and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous week in Playacar at Fishermen's resort and spa. I had read a few reviews and was skeptical, but I must say it was nothing like what I read. I love the size of the resort, small enough to never feel crowded. We enjoyed the spa and massages outside were the best! I highly recommend it with the breezes blowing on you and the sound of crashing waves. The rooms were awesome with great beds, hot tubs on the balconies. People had said there was no beach, we did not think so at all. We walked to other resorts that had no beach, but ours was perfect. The people who worked there were so nice and helpful. We said no to the timeshare presentation the first day and that was it, no one bugged us at all. My only complaint is that we were traveling with children 9 and 12 and they needed some activities. Easily could have put up a volleyball net, played music, or done something for the kids. All in all, it was awesome and I would highly recommend it to all!! Be sure to get to 5th Avenue and try to walk all 35 blocks of restaurants and shops. It is like nothing I have ever seen in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “This place is AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just purchased a 4 week time perpetual (lifetime) timeshare (studio) at Fisherman's yesterday. They were NOT shady at ALL!!! In fact, the manager kept throwing things into the deal even after we were already sold...I think that most of the people writing the bad reviews need to get their heads examined...Of course, anytime you go into a exclusive timeshare resort they will have sales staff trying to get you to purchase...That is how the world works, so if you want to be "STUPID" and not get a great deal then just don't go there, otherwise if you are looking for a deal you cannot refuse and you have some $$$, it really is a deal you simply cannot refuse. We had no "hard-sell" tactics when we went to check it out, on the other hand, they really did not have to sell us, we simply loved the place, and the the deal was great, so we bought a 4 week timeshare...No hassles, nothing that even comes close to resembling what all the bad reviews say, rather a very cool, laid back staff that helped to tailor the perfect package deal for us...It's this simple, if you don't have any money, than why go there in the first place??? By the way...It is breathtakingly beautiful. J & A, Highlands Ranch, CO, 80129

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read all the negative comments my wife and I were astounded at the friendliness of the staff, the amenities, the overall cleanliness and the ambience of the property. The meal plan food was typical buffet quality however it was overcome by the variety of food and service of the staff. As to the timeshare sales staff they are by no means as agressive as say the Mayan Palace, Velas or a host of others we have experienced over the past ten years as timeshare owners. I would definately recommend this resort to couples, singles and to families with children and we plan to return next year. The two bedroom units are large and moderate in quality and the studio units in the two new buildings even have a small kitchen area. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Skeptical owner relieved”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We purchased a timeshare from these folks last year on vacation to the riviera maya. Yes it was a high pressure sales pitch and after we returned to the states we were concerned about the investment we had made and after reading some of the reviews on this site we were even more concerned. I think the bad reviews written were mostly from people that expect to get something for nothing. This was our first year as owners and we were quite pleased with the resort. Our room was in the new tower and our room was every bit as nice as we expected. The food was good and plentiful. It is unfortunate about the beach but mother nature will rebuild it over time. The resort is small and quiet in the evenings. Jacuzzis by the spa are nice although we did not try the one in our room. it is only a quick ride or walk to downtown playa del carmen which is a nice little place. the view of the ocean is wonderful as you are right on the beach. Monica, our personal representative was very helpful for all of our needs. Even when we had to return to the states due to an emergency they allowed us to use the phone free of charge to change our reservations on the plane and also insured we had transportation to the airport without any hassle at all. the only thing we did not like was the timeshare salespeople. they are everywhere and will even try to sell an owner new "updates" but once we made it clear that we would answer no to all their requests we were not bothered with it again. Our room was directly below their sales office and as a result we had to listen to their sales meetings in the early morning, lots of clapping and women in heels walking above us but we were able to ignore it. We will return for another vacation here and will continue to say "no" to the salespeople. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited Cozumel and was talked into touring Fishermens, not realizing it was a time share presentation until we were on our way there. Very smooth presentation. 90min turned into hours of them wearing you down. Ashamed to admit to a purchase, but we did. Once home having buyer's remorse. Mexico has a 5 day period to get out of the contract, however the people at Fishermens are not forthcoming with the information as to how to go about doing this. e-mails and faxs have been sent to them, but of course with no reply from them. The resort is small and very pretty. The entire area is worth seeing and staying there. Would do it again without the time share presentation! Hopefully getting out of this won't be the hassle that I'm anticipating because that will really spoil the memory of the trip and make me reconsider visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit as members. We were a little concerned - had we made the right decision in purchasing this time share? We have come away with a sense of relief . . . our visit was great. We love the location - so close to Play Del Carmen. We did not purchase the meal plan and were quite happy with our decision. The few meals that we did purchase at the resort were good but we would likely have tired of them after 1 week. There were a few repairs that were needed to our room (leaky sink, doors did not lock properly, tv not the best) but overall were very happy with our accomodations. The staff were great and are incredibly hard workers. Unfortunatley the beach has suffered from Hurrican Ivan but hopefully they will be able to build it back up again. Looking forward to next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending one week at Sunset Fishermans Village. After looking at all the bad reviews on this site I was more than hesitant. Well its pretty amazing what people come up with, because this place was great. Yes, there are time share people there who try and rope you in. We had no problem at all with them, we just said the simple word "no" the first day and were never bothered again. We had a group of 14 people including a lot of kids and we all had a great time. My only complaint - check in was a slow boring process where they try to get you to do a time share talk - however they gave us food and drinks the whole time and it was only about noon and check in isnt until 3pm anyway, so its hard to complain. The food was good - its wasnt great, it wasnt fantastic, but it was good, plenty to keep you filled and plenty of variety. They have a separate "fancy" restaurant also which serves really good food if you want that also. Drinks - they have dos equis (XX) on tap for beer - light and dark. That is the only beer. If you get it in the bar they will serve it in a glass, if by the pool it will be in a plastic cup. Bloody marys - terrible. Margaritas, pina coladas, daquiries - all great. and you can drink as much as you want. Bar closes at 10:30pm. Beach - it exists, though the entire area has major beach erosion problems. This place sits right on the ocean, even in the ocean. Its beautiful, its small, intimate, a great place. 10 minute 1/2 mile walk to town. Employees - some good, some not so good as it can be anywhere. A couple of the bartenders were very very nice and friendly. It helps if you tip $1-5 a day if you want. Boogie boards, snorkeling equipment, kayaks, and bikes were all free to check out. You can snorkel right off the beach at the aritificial sand bag reefs about 100 yards out. I just wanted to set the record straight that this is a really nice place and dont listen to all the negative reviews. Its not a 5 star high class place, but I think for most people its close. If you like a small place on the beach, close to town with pretty good food and drinks and a nice pool and beach then you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Suspicious and shady place to be.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Another timeshare nightmare... this is a HUGE SCAM, a canned presentation with a bunch of shady actors... we were sucked in too, but found out that it was illegal for them to make us sign a letter saying we waived our right to the five day period for cancellation (mandatory under Mexican Law) (and yes, we are still embarrassed about having signed anything) but all the fake stories and no doubt fake names of these salesmen is part of the scam. When we went to cancel, (the next day)everyone working there gave everyone else the "knowing glance" so of course everyone whom we had talked to (about 5 or 6 people) were enjoying their "day off" (what a strange coincidence) We did manage to talk to one person who said it would all be taken care of when we came the next day... we were talked rudely to and when I had a conversation with a nice young couple about the questionable conduct of this company a big goon was upon me making threats in no time... we were escorted out but not before finding out from a guest that the rooms were nothing like the FAKE ROOM we saw.. the excuse was that it was not an ocean view, so we don't rent it out.... everything was a quick response... from why can't we see another room, where are the yachts that are supposed to be in your Marina.. and where IS your marina ... there are very few guests, i suppose that is because they don't really care if they have ANY guests because the main purpose is for them to oversell that one as they have been for a few years now.. For anyone going to Playa Del Carmen, or Playacar... if you go on one of these tours... notice these things... AND ASK.... just to see what kind of funny things they come up with.. 1. when you walk in there seems to be a lot of staff and action in the front lobby... notice then, that no one is doing anything except carrying around a walkie talkie and making sure that no one comes in who is not their without an invitation 2.
