There are no children around... and very few guests 4. Why do they need to see your VALID credit card? 5. Notice that there are NO JACUZZI'S on any balcony except the fake room (and they tell you that every room has a jacuzzi on the balcony) 4. It doesn't matter where you are from.. you're the lucky one because the boss is from there , and you will get a better break because their manager is from the same state or province or country that you are... they try to match you up with someone that you feel a bond with, that knows how things "are" back home. 5. After talking to others at our hotel we found that they start selling you a 69,000 life time plan and the more you say no the lower they go... and they will go to 1500 for two weeks at anytime of the year, in any of the rooms or suites... and then they will throw in some "free weeks" with RCI vouchers and their "corporate weeks" in which you are paying full all inclusive fare which is 75.00/day/person... and that is only IF you can book, which only 1 in 100,000 owners can apparently do.. and I think that is only in May or June THEY WILL THROW IN THE FARM BECAUSE YOUR MONEY IS LIKE A DONATION.... you will never get anything for your money, so even if they sign you to a 1500 deal, your bookings are all "subject to availability" so with that little clause, they never have to tell you if anything is available. 6. The person who was introduced to us as a "supervisor" was the security goon the next day.... and the desk clerks became the sales people etc etc... so it is a very connected little scam.. and ask yourself this WHY DOES THIS PLACE NEED SOOOOOOOOOO MUCH SECURITY? 7. They will get up from the table making you feel awkward.. then come back only to tell you that they have gone to the wall for you and now they have been authorized to give you an even better deal.. etc etc. until you stop saying no 8. They tell you the presentation wll be 90 minutes... we were there for 3 + hours... precious holiday time wasted! 9. With the numbers and deals that they throw at you in 3+ hours, you become weaker and mentally exhausted ( all part of the plan I am sure) 10. No one seems to have a last name 11. They refused to give us a credit note.. they just told us that they would take care of it and that it would take from 2-15 days. It has still not been credited 12. PROFECO is the place to write to and go for help, they are aware of this unscrupulous business practice and fight for the tourists protection from scams such as these. (this is the equivalent to the better business bureau) 13. Save yourself some time and lots of hassle, threats, and sleepless nights and just say NO. It would be great if everone took advantage of the bait (free tickets, dinners or 100.00 cash) and then didn't sign a thing... but I am more interested in the authorities investigating the whole operation. I for one, will not ever buy or deal with RCI, or any business associated with this kind of misrepresentation and misleading information as well as the outright lies that are also freely thrown around to persuade you to buy. Fisherman's Village and Mayan Palace........... search them on the internet and see what people are saying first... remember.. YOU DO HAVE 5 DAYS to change your mind! And perhaps more if you issue a complaint to PROFECO

Reviews.Title: “Skip it if you can!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Avoid it if you can! I canno't tell how poor service we got from staff, including the manager. Too many things need improvement starting with customer service skills. They run out of towels all the time, our room had a broken air conditioner and they never cared to fix it, regardless of our complaints. The only two good things about this hotel are its location (15 minute walk and you are right in Playacar downtown) and the beach . Facilities need improvement and staff need help in improving their customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled contract, and no money back!”
Reviews.Author: Prinna
Reviews.Content: In Jan. 2005, 2 of us bought a membership here. 2 days later, in writing and in person, we cancelled. 15 days after cancelling, our money should be refunded. It isn't. Reading other reviews, we have no expectation it ever will be without a fight. I was also charged more on my credit card than I assigned in the contract--no explanation. I call that fraud. Slime tactics to be aware of: 1) they don't use last names, 2) they try to force you to sign a waiver so you cannot cancel a contract within the 5 business days allowed by Mexican law, 3) their contracts have no addresses or phone numbers, just "Royal Fishermen's, S.A. De C.V", called the "Developer", 4) they liberally toss in extra weeks to get you to sign, which they tell you can be rented for more than enough to cover your annual maint. fee; the rentals don't happen; the rental company does not even return your phone calls, 5) they refused to give me any hardcopy documentation of my cancellation (I had written a letter I made them sign--they said that was enough); others have been told the cancellation was not valid or legally done or too late or never received, no matter how valid or on time, and in certified mail, 6) the 10-year yacht club membership, the "great" $50/hr deal for "million dollar yachts"...well, they aren't million dollar yachts (although nice boats), and if used once a year, one afternoon (4-hr min. rental), the upfront price and all the fees add up to rack rate, which you could pay without any contract or obligation at all; all this presumes you could always rent one on each of your vacations, when you wanted, 7) even the freebie promised to get you on site to their sales pitch came with a $25 price tag--imagine that!--supposedly completely refundable after you year the pitch (but maybe not if you don't buy); they use the angle that the town-roaming salesperson has to guarantee his catch by getting money down up front, so another sales agent can't steal his quarry; others I've talked to never got the promised freebie at all (they didn't sign up for a membership). We got the freebie, got our $25 back (but only because we asked for it before we terminated). But we were later threatened to pay for it. Verbal threats made to us indicated we had to pay for some free stuff they had given us to juice the deal (food, massage) or we'd have to sue to cancel and ever get our money back. No way were we going to give them any more money! We were also threatened that Mexican laws on slander and libel prohibited us from bad-mouthing them in any way, even if what we said was true. So consider yourself lucky if you steered clear of the ever-present salesmen (we were approached in a restaurant in downtown Playa del Carmen), or took the free bait and said NO to the presentation.

Reviews.Title: “How do you spell Ripoff? Fishermen's Village!”
Reviews.Author: DocWoz
Reviews.Content: I was another sucker who bought into this nightmare as an 'investment'. Now that I am $22k lighter and had a bilateral lobotomy, I see the error of my ways and hope others read these notes BEFORE venturing into this den of thieves. I tried to book a suite in December or January of 2004/2005 and was told nothing was available. This was in October when I contacted them. In November I tried again and was told they could fit me in at the end of March - Easter week! Although my contract and the timeshare pimp who sold it to me (Carlos the Chulango) said that 60 days is plenty ot time to book, the truth is they have way oversold the place. I visited there on Jan 3rd of 2005 to try and negotiate a way out as I still owe some cash (if you forget the fact they've already breached the contract). I even offered Luis, the new ladrone a few thousand to sell it off. He checked with his jefecita, Rosalea Perrita, and she called us back to say they "we're not in a position to buy back any timeshares". Big surprise there! They did tell me they have a total of 49 units available for use and are trying to buy back more units that were sold as condos. Interestingly they never mentioned during the sales pitch that some of the units they pointed to were not available to timeshare owners! When I asked how many timeshares they had sold, they just said 'Many'. That is the understatement of the year. Curiously, they offered me a place to stay after I told them I had already booked a condo and been in town a couple days. Amazing how nothing was available until I pressed the issue. Of course it was of no use to me as I was already prepaid at the condo. While we waited to talk to the timeshare pimps this time, they offered us drinks. The service was poor, as it was when I ate there a couple years ago, so I am at odds to understand the postings that indicate how great the staff is. Our bartender had the personality of drywall. When my fiance spoke to him in Spanish, her native toungue, he was still the same. I guess a rotten place like this even wears on the staff. If you buy a timeshare anywhere, realize they cannot easily be resold, if at all, and when it's possible to unload them, you can expect less than 50% of your money back. I am planning to erect a website to this fiasco and would be interested in others' stories regarding this dump. This resort is giving PDC a bad name.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dede
Reviews.Content: After 3+ hours, we, too, signed on the dotted line and gave them our credit card. Luckily, we read the small print and realized our poor judgment. We returned the following day to cancel pursuant to the 5 day termination clause in the contract. After being forced to under go more strong-arms sales we finally received a contract termination document to sign and they asked for our credit card to do a credit adjustment. Before returning our credit card and the signed termination document we were insulted and verbally abused by someone who identified himself as one of the devlopers. We were truly afraid that they were not going to return our credit card or the contract termination document, but finally they did. But, guess what, it's been over a month and they still have not submitted the credit to our credit card company and we are now in the process of attempting to prove our case. I would not, under any circumstance, give these people my business or recommend their facilities to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not so happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to one of there so called timeshare meetings. Three hours later they finally wore us done to buy one of their timeshares. I was promised that it would be no problem backing out if we want to. We called, wrote and sent a fed ex letter to cancel within their five days and they still are saying we have to stay in the program. Don't believe anything they have to say, including Brandon Ronsburg. He is their sales manager.

Reviews.Title: “hook line and stinker”
Reviews.Content: Hi I bought into the hoax of fishermans and paid my money but when I went to book my time in the whole story changed, If anybody gets talked into this place Read the fine print do not beleive anything they tell you. We bought 2 weeks were told we could carry them forward for 4 weeks every 2 years. Then when we went to book we were told we could only stay at fishermans for 1 week and have to go to the Mayan Palace for the rest of our stay. Anyway I hope enough people complain or get together and maybe things will change. Its to bad because it is really a very nice place. Also trying to book the times we wanted turned out to be impossible. Wanted to go in Feb 05 ended up Mar-Apr

Reviews.Title: “resort food needs alot of attention”
Reviews.Author: rsmach111
Reviews.Content: hi just came back from fishermans village..nice place to stay. great location . very relaxing .for those who like to do stuff, we were able to walk to town 15 min walk where everything is. take a ferry 30 mins to cozemel. or take a buse to cancun in 45 min for $3.20. but, the food was not real appealing. breakfast was the best meal . they had a buffet where you could get eggs easy over or omelet made with what ever you wanted. fresh fruit plenty of breads.as for dinners go out to eat except atalian night.eat there...the best night. (thursday night). six of us went and all feel the same way. as for time share people ,they do come in the mornings and place gets crowded with them. of time share people walking around. warm beer on tap.yuk. but bar tenders are great.they will try to make you a special drink using the booze that is on your plan. so there are no coronas on premises. you can go for a 15 min walk and purchase bud,corona or what ever you would like. as for the staff-cant ask for a better group of people. i went around on last day and gave out extra tip money to the people I felt made my vacation special. just leaving out the chef.....sorry chef you need to improve the food..... we did get to try other great places...give this resort a very bad grade for the food.

Reviews.Title: “Great for total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: joanne1120
Reviews.Content: Just returned 10/23/04. Was very skeptical because I read some bad reviews, believe me it was great. We bought the timeshare last year and this was our fist time staying there. We biught a large unit that slept 8, when we arrived jOse Luis offered us our choice of a 3 bedroom or the original unit we purchased. There were 8 of us, so we took the the 3 bedroom. (no extra charge) For the entire week everyone on the staff went out of thier way to make sure we were happy. Some reviewers complained about the food, I say you want American food stay in USA. I am a very pickey eater, but I found pleanty to eat. We ate lunch 4 days and chose dinner the other 3, we should have taken all dinners. The soups they made were unbelievable and I we all found a varity to eat. David and Samel were wonder ful and sent a bottle of to us twice. You should know that this is not an all inclusive, but rather a meal plan and it worked fine for us. I love the complaint if you like fresh fruit you will happy. The snack bar was areal bargin too. Because we were owners we got a 20% discount. Twice we ate there and just orderd nachos, qusadas, fries and burgers, One day the bill was 28.00 the other 21.00. We have the Yatch package and took out a beautiful 47 ft, with a captin and 1st mate. This yatch was 2 bedrooms and 2 baths it was just magnificent. Because we did not know where e wanted to go, they picked 3 spots. One was a beach you can swim with sharks ( for only a donation) , so they were nurse sharks and do not bite it was still nice, then we went to North Beach we swam off the boat it was great. I do not remember 3rd place. We stopped at the resort in March ( on a cuise), from then until now I would say they lost 60% of the beach, but to be honest it was too hot to stay on the beach , you were better off at the pool. This is total relaxation. Any questions, e-mail me

Reviews.Title: “Scam, scam , scam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, we started out being misled and ended up being misled. It's amazing how many people are involved in these "timeshare scams". They start you out with a couple of nice "local" people that tell you things like, "Yeah, all you have to do is just check out our rooms to see if you would like to stay at our hotel at some point during your vacation", joke, none of the rooms are for rent. Once they get you in you have to go through a series of levels within the scam. Starts with the nice guy who shows you pictures of his family, tells you stories of the history of the area and shows you the staged, best view rooms in the complex. Kind of sad really because you know they are just trying to make a living. It's once they get into that one exit room that the fun begins. Again, the levels kick in, the first guy goes over the packages and of course there insanely high. At that point your just like "well thanks, but I'm going to go with no as my answer", after several drops in price and a lot of pen circling and disappointed looks from the person he reluctantly says "OK, well you'll just have to give this next person a quick review and we'll give you your present", at this point they say they will release you from captivity, oh, I mean let you leave of course... Then he tries one more time with an even better offer and after he does some more pen circling and pointing to the papers a little more sternly he finally gives you the fakest "Oh, you win look" and tells you "OK, now you just have to talk to one more person, real quick". This is when they introduce what I like to call "The closer", this guy tried so hard and with so much pressure it almost made you feel like you just might not make it out of there alive without signing up to something, it was like your totally stupid if you did not take the deal. Really, really sad. Well, we escaped, not until after three hours!!! Unbelievable. A whole day basically wasted. What they don't tell you is that it's almost impossible to rent out your timeshare, the room that they showed you in the beginning is not an example of the type of room you will get if you stay there and that getting a room for the week you want down the road is almost impossible as well. The main problem being that they have oversold these condos, apartments, rooms, whatever, into the ground. I feel sorry for those people that made the walk of shame out to the front lobby with that little bag containing a cheap certificate that certifies that have just purchased a major headache, but hey, at least you can feel good about supporting some of the "locals". Did I mention our "closer" was from Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Way overbooked”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We purchased a Time Share at FV in Feb. 2003. I wanted to book for Feb. 2005 and all is already all booked. This is very disappointing as they are selling new memberships everyday so obviously they are selling way more memberships than there are rooms available. We are trying to sell our time share but have not had any buyers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My parents and I purchased a time share last year at Fishermen's Village. I have to say that we were slightly pressured into the time share and were a little worried before we went. I want to warn people that if they do purchase a time share, that they not use the company that Fisherman's Village recommended to sell their extra weeks-Vacation Weeks---. Our deal was to purshase one week and they would give us three others to use or sell. The rep at Vacation Weeks was very nice in the beginning when they were trying to get the initial $500 fee from us. They told us to expect our first check within 60-90 days, well, it is almost a year later and nothing. And when you try calling them or sending emails, they do not respond. Anyway....Once we got to the resort, we had a slight problem with our room and we had asked to upgrade. Everyone right from the start was very nice. The time share that we purchased last year was a studio with two queen beds, a kitchenette, dining/living room. We had tried to use a second week, but were told over the past several weeks that there were none available. There were four of us using the time share, so we were hoping to get two bedrooms. On the second day, we were able to upgrade to a two story condo with 2 bedrooms and 2 1/2 baths and a beautiful view. They only charged us $200 to upgrade. I thought that was a pretty good deal! My husband, mother and I loved the resort. It was quiet and never very crowded, except for all of the time share groups coming through daily. They were not a bother, but more amusing then anything. Many mornings we had the pool almost exclusively to ourselves. The resort has snorkeling gear and kayaks which we used a few times. The sand was very soft unlike the resort that we stayed at last year that was near a coral reef. Last year's resort was better for snorkeling but very rough on your feet. My father is very restless so he prefers a resort with more things to do. For rest of us, it was perfect. We purchased the meal plan. I was also worried about this purchase after reading all of the negative reviews regarding the food and drinks. I was glad that we purchased the plan. I thought the breakfasts were very good, always a variety of fresh fruit and many other things to eat. We only had the lunch buffet one time and the rest of the time we simply got snacks at the pool bar. Our bartender, Manuel was fantastic. Very friendly and always remembered what we were drinking. We ate lunch at the pool bar every day and charged it our room. At the end of the week the tab for the snacks was only $50 for four people. The drinks we also thought were very good. I read a review saying that the drinks were watered down, well, if you feel that way, all you have to do is ask for them to put more alcohol in your mixed drink or simply get more. If you are lounging at the pool, the waiters also come around and bring you drinks. The dinners were okay. They had buffets and Italian night off of the menu. Italian night was good but they had that 3 nights while we were there. One night was enough of the Italian. We did however go into town two nights for dinner, which were not that great. We spent too much money. One of the tourists at the resort recommended Limones for Lobster, well we did not enjoy that restaraunt. My mother is a lobster fanatic and was very dissapointed. My husband and I also enjoyed massages outside on the patio at the spa. It was wonderful, very relaxing and all the while that you are getting the massage you can hear the ocean. Fantastic!! Again, I have to praise the staff. The ones that stuck out were Manuel-the bartender, Jose Louis- activity man, and Marcel, our bellboy. Everyone went out of their way to make this a great vacation for us. My husband and I are thinking about going back again in May with some friends. I would highly recommend this resort. If anyone has any questions, please feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Great time - Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: PadreFan2004
Reviews.Content: I don't understand some people. My wife and I spent a week at FV and had the best time. If you want the big hotel type atmosphere then don't stay here. I went to relax and enjoy Mexico. I must say the dinners could be improved. We went out to Playa Del Carmen for dinners 4 of the 7 nights. ( Great places to eat and good choices). The people working at the hotel there were great as well as our room. We were on the second floor over looking the ocean - which was only feet away. The room has jazuzzis on the balconies. The beach behind the FV is beautiful. We did get approached about timeshares and took the tour for $300 worth of spa activities. We were not pressured at all and enjoyed two days of massages free. We rented a car all week and took in all the sites - Tulum , Tres Rios, Chitzen Itza, Playa Del Carmen and Cancun. We traded through RCI and had to pay for the all- inclusive package ( $40.00 per adult per day) This included Breakfast ( not bad), and lunch ( order from the Menu) or Dinner ( the Italian night was very good), the rest of the nights are Buffet style. You have to pay for all 7 days. Overall this is a great place to get away and listen to the ocean. I would surely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star at best!”
Reviews.Author: ninak
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were never very high after reading all the reviews, but we were still a bit disappionted after being there for a week. I will keep it short and sweet. THE PRO'S: beautiful location, 10 minute walk from downtown Playa, and our room was spacious. THE CON'S: service is okay at best, the drinks ARE watered down, the beach is almost non-existent, the pool needs a face lift, the spa is a joke, and the food is horrible. This is our 8th time going to the area and we have never stayed at the same place twice. We're not picky, but we like to explore different places each time we go. On a scale of 1 to 10, with 10 being the best, this place rated a 4. My best advice is read all of the reviews before you make a decision on where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Trapped by salesmen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were approached by a representative of this property at our hotel. We were told they would like for us to look at this hotel to consider for a future trip. We explained we travel with a group of six couples and we might be interested. They gave us a good deal (we thought) on some sight seeing attractions and told us we would spend about 90 minutes touring the hotel. We found out after we got there it is a time share scheme. We were kept there for three hours, we had three different salesmen try to sell us. We were high pressured and told before we could go we would have to talk to someone so we could be "released". We did not have enough time to enjoy the sight seeing attractions because we were held hostage soooo long. We thought we were going to be able to swim with the dolphins but they failed to tell us we needed reservations. When we got to Xel-Ha we were told it was so late that we could not swim with the dolphins. I had a nine year old granddaughter that was terribly upset. I would like to know the name of the rich man in Texas that is part owner, according to the sales people, so I can contact him personnally. I would not stay there and I would recommend that you not go for fear you will not be released and have to spend the rest of your life listening to their sales pitch. The whole day was a bust and I'm writing to our hotel and suggesting that they not allow those people in their hotel. Ron

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a WONDERFUL a two week vacation in Playa del Carmen. The first week we stayed at the Mayan Palace and the second week at Fishermans Spa and Resort. Fishermans is a much more intimate resort and located in a beautiful residential type area - Playacar. We did not buy into the meal plan and never had a meal there. We went to a grocery store in Playa del Carmen (PDC) so bought breakfast and snack food. The kitchenette was sufficient for what we needed. We had a rental car which was a good choice for us. We had dinner in PDC most every night. Our room was always very clean, the staff kind and helpful. We were located on the first floor, 1 bedroom, sitting area, kitchenette, beautiful ocean view, small patio with jacuzzi. No one ever harrassed us about timeshare presentations. The pool area is very nice, several hammocks in a nicely shaded area right on the beach. The beach is small but beautiful. This resort was just perfect for us. We didn't stay there during the day since we had a car. We did a lot of exploring on our own. My husband and I recommend this resort for anyone looking for intimacy and central location.

Reviews.Title: “Meh, it was ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: These positive reviews come from vactioners who don't like to do much but sit around, relax on what little beach there is (I have pictures to show how small this beach is) and prefer extremely watered down drinks. If you want nightlife or even casual shopping/walking/people watching, this is not the place for you. The hotel is nice. The staff is great -except for the Time Share Pimps. And the hotel management constantly bothers you every time they see you for more money for the meal plan, every day they asked me at least 2x when I am checking out, settling my bill (all of 5 pesos come on!) and when I am paying for my meal plan -all this was paid before I even got on the plane and by day 3 of this, it got rather old. The plus side to this is that the Time Share Pimps only hassle you if they can tell you are over 40. As if being over 40 means you have money. For me, at 32, with money to invest if anyone asked, it was a relief. Visually, it's awesome. We had problems with our A/C units leaking (kitchen and master bedroom in room 349) and numerous calls to maintenance really didn't do much. The morning slip n slide in the kitchen was extremely dangerous and we're grateful no one got hurt with falls. The drywall is sagging and warped from the leaking and we had bets to when it was just going to crash out of the ceiling. The electrical layout is scary. There are outlets on the floor for the TV and cable... which is not far from where the water pools from the leaking A/C. Terrible design concepts. It seems par for the course at this place, however, considering the maintence people ran live wires across the pool, and draped into the pool for their power tools -this was an electrocution in the making. If a guest didn't see the pieced-together extension cords, forget it, there would have been serious problems. No real regard for the safety of the guests with this situation, they still allowed people to swim in the pool while this work was going on. The meal plan is a rip-off. Save your money. Buy your booze in town, make lots of ice and make your own drinks. The drinks at the bars are a joke, they are so watered down it's laughable. And the pool bar closes at 5 and the lobby bar closed at 9:30-10pm most nights. The latest it was open was 10:05. If you have any sort of pulse in the evenings, this isn't the place to be. Of course, even if you have a pulse, an hour or two listening to a panflute version of the soundtrack to the Titanic will make you wish for your pulse to cease. Breakfast was a debacle. The food was crummy and limited unless the Potential Time Share Victims were bussed in. Then breakfast was plentiful, many options, but good luck getting anything when the Time Share Promoters are there because they bully you, they are rude to you, unless you're there to be schmoozed into making them some commission, forget it, they will treat you like garbage. The staff is obviously taught that the potential victims are more important than the regular guests (probably because they already got their commissions from the regular guests) and it made for subpar service. When there were no potential time share victims, breakfast was horrible but the service was great. Lunch meal plan is a joke. Again, don't waste your money. The snack bar is nice (by the pool) and a little more worth the $ if you're not on the meal plan. Dinner was repetitive, recycled leftovers and generally boring. Only 2 nights wes there something different. Save your money, eat in town, it's a far better experience. The tours offered through the hotel concierge are such a rip off scam, it baffles me how people fall for it. Tulum, $100 per person. XCaret $126 per person. PER PERSON! Cozumel day trip $75 per person. Are these people on crack? Who would pay this to do anything? Stupid tourists will pay it and will continue to pay it, which is how they get away with ripping you off even more. Don't be a fool. And don't buy into the scams to get you into time share pitches just to get a cheap entry or cheap tour. You have to provide your credit card and ID (to prove you can afford to be there) but if you're foolish enough to surrender your credit info to some guy in a booth, well you deserve to be ripped off. Once you say "I don't have a credit card", they're done with you. Just avoid the hassles. And if you don't say anything figuring you'll just drop the bomb on them once you're wherever it is they're taking you, they'll leave you there. 5 of us went to Tulum (including food and transportation) for $75. If we went thru the hotel, that'd be $500. ALL of us went for $75. Take the free hotel ride into town, take the bus for $3 and the entry to Tulum is only $3.80. When you're in town, buy a couple bottles of water and a snack. On the way back, barter with a taxi or van driver. If you can read, you can navigate Tulum. 6 of us went to XCaret for a little more mainly because XCaret is about $50 U.S. But we took the van into town, batered with a driver and got a ride there for $20, went around XCaret for the whole day, and got a ride back for $15. Again, if you can read, you can navigate XCaret fine enough on your own. If you have a good zoo/rainforest/eco park near your home, save your money. The swimming area smells like a cesspool, the snorkeling isn't all that great because they let in zillions of kids -how many fish are going to stick around for that commotion? It's really not worth it unless it's the only place you can see such things. Cozumel was the biggest farce at $75. HAHAH!!! Again, take the free hotel ride to town. You walk to the ferry, buy your RT ticket for $18. Go have a meal, shop around, barter with a taxi to get you where you want to go. Even with shopping, I only spent a total of $45, including generous tips and real alcohol (certainly wasn't getting any at the hotel!) The only thing I saw people do here that was stupid was go when the cruise ships are docked. Does no one know that prices will be MORE when this happens and not LESS? Go after 2pm -you can see the ships from Playa- when the ships go off, that's when you go to Cozumel. Drinks during cruise time were 2 for $5, 2 for $6. We drank later in the day, they were 2 for $3 or buy one get one and all the cheesy shopping was much much cheaper. Cozumel is a big tourist trap if you're stupid. I'm definitely staying at the Royal Sunset in Cancun next year. At least there one can have a pulse and experience life after dark. I'll never do a meal plan again. It's cheaper to go to the market and buy bottled water and liquor and eat at the area restaurants. Plus it's much more fun and a better way to meet people. This trip was great because of the people and if I ignore the hotel situation and location and the tiny beach. The staff was wonderful, friendly, social, and very willing to give you a heads up on where the good places are to go. If you're a generous tipper, you'll be treated like royalty. If you're a stingy bugger, you'll get standard service. But this goes for anywhere. What got this hotel a lower rating for me was the A/C situation, the skimpy supply of towels (we had 6 people and had to trek to the front desk every day for adequate towel supplies, where again we were met with asking for more money or blank stares from management. If you are able to find general staffers, seek them out for your needs, management doesn't do anything but hassle you for money) lack of equipment (snorkeling and boogie boards) and the fact that every day we tried to rent something, we were told the surf was too rough. Isn't that the point? But the surf wasn't rough at all. There are a lot of rocks and concrete once you get to about knee deep out in the water. And no one tells you they're there, but you'll gash up your feet pretty quick. Watch out for the jellyfish, too, when rain is imminent. The snorkel guy will tell you they don't bite, but we have stings all over to prove otherwise. Thankfully nothing toxic enough to get anyone sick, but to tell guests lies isn't conducive to good customer relations.

HotelInfo.Name: Sunset Fishermen Spa & Resort
HotelInfo.Address: Bahia del Espiritu Santo #9 | Playacar, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
